text:
Overview
HackerEarth is an online technical-recruitment tool that enables you to automate your hiring process to select the best fit for your team.
Using HackerEarth Assessment, you can create tests to evaluate candidates. By automating your recruitment process, HackerEarth Assessment saves the time and effort required to go through hundreds of resumes manually. It allows you to assess and shortlist a targeted pool of candidates who suit your requirements.
This article gives you an in-depth understanding of HackerEarth Assessment and its benefits. By using HackerEarth, you can streamline the recruitment process and find the perfect candidate for your team.
Why should you use HackerEarth Assessment?
HackerEarth provides you with industry-leading features which are as follows:
1. HackerEarth's rich library
HackerEarth's library is a repository of pre-built questions that can be used to create customized tests for assessing candidates. The library contains a vast collection of questions that cover various topics across difficulty levels. The questions are designed and tested by subject matter experts and are frequently updated to ensure that they are relevant and up to industry standards.
You can also filter the questions by difficulty level, skills, and other criteria to create a well-balanced test that accurately evaluates a candidate's skills.
In addition to the pre-built questions, the library also includes coding challenges that can be used to evaluate a candidate's coding skills in a real-world scenario. These challenges are designed to simulate the challenges that developers face in their day-to-day work, giving you a better idea of a candidate's ability to handle real-world situations.
Overall, HackerEarth's rich library is a valuable resource for recruiters and hiring managers who are looking to create customized tests that accurately assess a candidate's skills. With its vast collection of pre-built questions and coding challenges, the library can help you streamline the recruitment process and identify the best candidates for your organization.
2. Increase the number of candidates assessed
HackerEarth Assessment is designed to help you assess a large pool of candidates in a concise span of time. This means that you can quickly filter through a high volume of resumes and identify the best fit for your team. With HackerEarth Assessment, you can increase the number of candidates you assess, which can help you find the perfect candidate for your organization. This is particularly useful when you have multiple positions to fill or when you are looking to scale your team quickly. By automating the recruitment process, HackerEarth Assessment saves you time and effort and enables you to assess more candidates efficiently. This not only helps you find the right candidate faster but also ensures that you don't miss out on any potential hires.
3. Diverse platform
HackerEarth Assessment is a versatile platform that allows you to assess candidates in over 38 different programming languages. This feature makes it easier for you to find candidates with the specific technical skills that your organization needs. The diverse platform also includes a range of question types and difficulty levels, enabling you to create customized tests that accurately assess a candidate's skills. Additionally, you can upload your own questions to create a tailor-made test that meets your specific requirements. The diverse platform ensures that candidates are evaluated based on their technical skills, making it easier for you to identify the right fit for your team.
4. Advanced proctoring settings for assessments
Advanced proctoring settings for assessments ensure that the tests are conducted in a fair and unbiased manner. HackerEarth Assessment provides best-in-class proctoring mechanisms to prevent cheating and ensure the integrity of the tests. These mechanisms include features such as webcam monitoring, screen recording, and keystroke tracking.
Webcam monitoring allows you to monitor the candidate's actions during the test. This ensures that the candidate is not looking at external resources, talking to someone else, or using any other unfair means during the test. The screen recording feature captures the candidate's screen activity during the test. This helps you identify any suspicious activity or unauthorized software usage. Keystroke tracking records the keystrokes made by the candidate during the test. This feature helps you identify any suspicious activity or unauthorized software usage.
Overall, advanced proctoring settings ensure that the tests are conducted in a fair and unbiased manner, enabling you to identify the best fit for your team.
5. Reports and analytics
HackerEarth Assessment also offers detailed reports and analytics. These reports give you an insight into each candidate's performance based on various test metrics, including accuracy, speed, and efficiency. You can use this data to identify the strengths and weaknesses of each candidate and make informed hiring decisions.
Moreover, HackerEarth Assessment provides smart analytics around usage and recruitment activity to help you make necessary decisions for future recruitment needs. This includes information on the number of tests taken, test completion rates, and candidate performance trends. With this data, you can easily track the effectiveness of your recruitment process and identify areas for improvement.
6. Dedicated account manager and product specialist available 24/7
HackerEarth Assessment offers exceptional service for its assessments, with a dedicated account manager and product specialist available 24/7 to assist with any technical issues. This guarantees a smooth and hassle-free experience while utilizing the platform to find the ideal candidate for your team.
To know more about how HackerEarth Assessment helped organizations in hiring effectively, click here.
What are the advantages of using HackerEarth Assessment?
There are various advantages of using HackerEarth assessments which are as follows:
Enables remote recruitment drives across multiple locations for seamless scaling
Reduces manual effort and time to conduct technical assessments by automating the recruitment process
Creates customized tests in minutes
Assesses candidates in 37 different programming languages
Generates tests automatically from a well-curated library of questions specially designed to test technical candidates
Evaluates tests automatically to shortlist the best candidates
Provides best-in-class proctoring mechanisms to ensure fair assessments
Evaluate a candidate's programming, problem-solving, and analytical skills and provide a detailed report on their performance to make informed hiring decisions
Screens the best candidates using the auto-ranking mechanism and performance-based filters
Provides reliable customer service to handle unforeseen technical challenges

# Overview

## HackerEarth is an online technical-recruitment tool that enables you to automate your hiring process to select the best fit for your team.

Using HackerEarth Assessment, you can create tests to evaluate candidates. By automating your recruitment process, HackerEarth Assessment saves the time and effort required to go through hundreds of resumes manually. It allows you to assess and shortlist a targeted pool of candidates who suit your requirements.

This article gives you an in-depth understanding of HackerEarth Assessment and its benefits. By using HackerEarth, you can streamline the recruitment process and find the perfect candidate for your team.

### **Why should you use HackerEarth Assessment?**

HackerEarth provides you with industry-leading features which are as follows:

#### 1\. HackerEarth's rich library

HackerEarth's library is a repository of pre-built questions that can be used to create customized tests for assessing candidates. The library contains a vast collection of questions that cover various topics across difficulty levels. The questions are designed and tested by subject matter experts and are frequently updated to ensure that they are relevant and up to industry standards.

You can also filter the questions by difficulty level, skills, and other criteria to create a well-balanced test that accurately evaluates a candidate's skills.

These challenges are designed to simulate the challenges that developers face in their day-to-day work, giving you a better idea of a candidate's ability to handle real-world situations.

Overall, HackerEarth's rich library is a valuable resource for recruiters and hiring managers who are looking to create customized tests that accurately assess a candidate's skills. With its vast collection of pre-built questions and coding challenges, the library can help you streamline the recruitment process and identify the best candidates for your organization.

#### ![Screenshot from 2023-09-26 16-16-22](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-26%2016-16-22.png?width=688&height=353&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-26%2016-16-22.png)

#### 2\. Increase the number of candidates assessed

HackerEarth Assessment is designed to help you assess a large pool of candidates in a concise span of time. This means that you can quickly filter through a high volume of resumes and identify the best fit for your team. With HackerEarth Assessment, you can increase the number of candidates you assess, which can help you find the perfect candidate for your organization. This is particularly useful when you have multiple positions to fill or when you are looking to scale your team quickly. By automating the recruitment process, HackerEarth Assessment saves you time and effort and enables you to assess more candidates efficiently. This not only helps you find the right candidate faster but also ensures that you don't miss out on any potential hires.

#### 3\. Diverse platform

HackerEarth Assessment is a versatile platform that allows you to assess candidates in over 38 different programming languages. This feature makes it easier for you to find candidates with the specific technical skills that your organization needs. The diverse platform also includes a range of question types and difficulty levels, enabling you to create customized tests that accurately assess a candidate's skills. Additionally, you can upload your own questions to create a tailor-made test that meets your specific requirements. The diverse platform ensures that candidates are evaluated based on their technical skills, making it easier for you to identify the right fit for your team.

#### 4\. Advanced proctoring settings for assessments

Advanced proctoring settings for assessments ensure that the tests are conducted in a fair and unbiased manner. HackerEarth Assessment provides best-in-class proctoring mechanisms to prevent cheating and ensure the integrity of the tests. These mechanisms include features such as webcam monitoring, screen recording, and keystroke tracking.

Webcam monitoring allows you to monitor the candidate's actions during the test. This ensures that the candidate is not looking at external resources, talking to someone else, or using any other unfair means during the test. The screen recording feature captures the candidate's screen activity during the test. This helps you identify any suspicious activity or unauthorized software usage. Keystroke tracking records the keystrokes made by the candidate during the test. This feature helps you identify any suspicious activity or unauthorized software usage.

Overall, advanced proctoring settings ensure that the tests are conducted in a fair and unbiased manner, enabling you to identify the best fit for your team.

#### 5\. Reports and analytics

HackerEarth Assessment also offers detailed reports and analytics. These reports give you an insight into each candidate's performance based on various test metrics, including accuracy, speed, and efficiency. You can use this data to identify the strengths and weaknesses of each candidate and make informed hiring decisions.

Moreover, HackerEarth Assessment provides smart analytics around usage and recruitment activity to help you make necessary decisions for future recruitment needs. This includes information on the number of tests taken, test completion rates, and candidate performance trends. With this data, you can easily track the effectiveness of your recruitment process and identify areas for improvement.

#### **6\. Dedicated account manager and product specialist available 24/7**

HackerEarth Assessment offers exceptional service for its assessments, with a dedicated account manager and product specialist available 24/7 to assist with any technical issues. This guarantees a smooth and hassle-free experience while utilizing the platform to find the ideal candidate for your team.

To know more about how HackerEarth Assessment helped organizations in hiring effectively, click [here](https://www.hackerearth.com/recruiters/customers/).

### **What are the advantages of using HackerEarth Assessment?**

There are various advantages of using HackerEarth assessments which are as follows:

*   Enables remote recruitment drives across multiple locations for seamless scaling
*   Reduces manual effort and time to conduct technical assessments by automating the recruitment process
*   Creates customized tests in minutes
*   Assesses candidates in 37 different programming languages
*   Generates tests automatically from a well-curated library of questions specially designed to test technical candidates  
    
*   Evaluates tests automatically to shortlist the best candidates
*   Provides best-in-class proctoring mechanisms to ensure fair assessments
*   Evaluate a candidate's programming, problem-solving, and analytical skills and provide a detailed report on their performance to make informed hiring decisions
*   Screens the best candidates using the auto-ranking mechanism and performance-based filters
*   Provides reliable customer service to handle unforeseen technical challenges

text:
Troubleshooting camera permissions
The Camera Permissions dialog box will not be displayed when the status of the camera is disabled. Follow these steps to enable camera permissions on different browsers:
Google Chrome
On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open permission dialog.
Select Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your camera.

Click Done.
For more details, read this.
Mozilla Firefox
On the Address bar, click .
Click to enable camera permissions.
Note: The ‘You may need to reload the page for changes to apply’ message will be displayed on the screen.
Click .
Click Allow in the dialog box that is displayed on the screen.

For more details, read this.
Edge
Open the test link in Microsoft Edge.
If the webcam is disabled, then the following dialog box appears on your screen:

Click .
Select the checkbox beside Always allow https://www.hackerearth.com to access your camera.

Click Done. 
Safari
Click Safari.
Click Preference to open the Preference window.
On the Toolbar, click Websites.
In the General section, click Camera.
In the Currently Open Websites window, select Allow beside hackerearth.com.
Close the window and refresh the page.

For more details, read this.
Even though I have set the camera permissions to Allowed, the compatibility check fails. What do I do?
Check if the camera is being used in multiple tabs or browsers. If yes, then close the tabs (or browsers) and refresh the test page. 
Your system will now meet the system-compatibility requirements for the webcam and you will be able to proceed.
If this option does not work, close and open your browser again.
Unable to fix your webcam issue? Contact us on support@hackerearth.com.
markdown:
# Troubleshooting camera permissions

The Camera Permissions dialog box will not be displayed when the status of the camera is disabled. Follow these steps to enable camera permissions on different browsers:

### Google Chrome

1.  On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open permission dialog.
2.  Select **Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your camera**.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-40-43-9988-AM.png)  
    
3.  Click **Done**.

For more details, read [this](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/2693767?hl=en).

### Mozilla Firefox

1.  On the Address bar, click ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-40-49-5046-AM.png).
    
    ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-40-46-1356-AM.png)
    
2.  Click ![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-40-47-3031-AM.png) to enable camera permissions.  
    **Note**: The ‘**You may need to reload the page for changes to apply**’ message will be displayed on the screen.
3.  Click ![mceclip5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-40-50-6187-AM.png).
4.  Click **Allow** in the dialog box that is displayed on the screen.  
    ![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip6-Jan-30-2023-11-40-53-3337-AM.png)  
    

For more details, read [this](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1070636).

### Edge

1.  Open the test link in Microsoft Edge.
2.  If the webcam is disabled, then the following dialog box appears on your screen:  
    ![mceclip7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-40-54-6714-AM.png)  
    
3.  Click ![mceclip8.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip8-Jan-30-2023-11-40-55-8004-AM.png).
4.  Select the checkbox beside **Always allow [https://www.hackerearth.com](https://www.hackerearth.com/) to access your camera**.  
    ![mceclip9.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip9-Jan-30-2023-11-40-48-3844-AM.png)  
    
5.  Click **Done**.

### Safari

1.  Click Safari.
2.  Click **Preference** to open the **Preference** window.
3.  On the Toolbar, click **Websites**.
4.  In the **General** section, click **Camera**.
5.  In the **Currently Open Websites** window, select **Allow** beside hackerearth.com.
6.  Close the window and refresh the page.  
    ![mceclip10.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip10-Jan-30-2023-11-40-52-0158-AM.png)  
    

For more details, read [this](https://support.apple.com/en-in/guide/safari/welcome).

**Even though I have set the camera permissions to Allowed, the compatibility check fails. What do I do?**

Check if the camera is being used in multiple tabs or browsers. If yes, then close the tabs (or browsers) and refresh the test page.

Your system will now meet the system-compatibility requirements for the webcam and you will be able to proceed.

If this option does not work, close and open your browser again.

Unable to fix your webcam issue? Contact us on [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com).

markdown:
# Logging into HackerEarth Assessment

The first thing that you must do after you have subscribed to a plan of HackerEarth Assessment is:

*   Log in
*   Set up your account

### Email and password

To log into the HackerEarth Assessment account by entering the email ID and password, follow these steps:

1.  Click [https://www.hackerearth.com/recruit/login/](https://www.hackerearth.com/recruit/login/).
2.  Enter your email ID.
3.  Enter your password.  
    
4.  Click **Login**.

### Single sign-on (SSO)

Now, you can log into HackerEarth with a single set of credentials and gain access to multiple accounts without the hassle of maintaining different sets of usernames and passwords for each. If you are logged into HackerEarth, you are automatically logged into the HackerEarth Assessment as well.

**Note**

*   You must have an account at HackerEarth Recruit to enable SSO login for your office email ID.
*   This feature is only available for G Suite domains.
*   This is a premium feature. To enable SSO login, contact us at [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com) or your respective PoC.

To log into your account by using single sign-on, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Login with SSO**.
2.  Enter your email ID.
3.  Click **Login**.

### Signing in with Google

**Prerequisites**: You must be logged into Google by the same account that you want to use while logging into HackerEarth.

Click **Sign in with Google** and you will be redirected to the Administrator dashboard of HackerEarth Assessment.

You have successfully logged in and you will see the administrator dashboard.

text:
Question settings
You can make settings related to the questions in the tests that you create, in this section.
Shuffling questions
Use this option to shuffle the order of questions in a test.
Important: This is different from randomizing questions in a test using the question pooling feature.
When you make this setting, it applies to all the questions in the test. It will not have an impact on the options of the MCQs in your test. You can enable this setting under Proctoring settings.
Enabling Cut-off scores
Use this option to set a recommendation score that will act as an indication for you when you are filtering candidates who have taken a specific test. 
For example, if you set the cut-off score at 90, you can manually filter the scores in the candidate report. This will give you a more realistic number of candidates who you can further evaluate and interview. You can enable this setting under Cut-off settings.
Language settings
Use this option to make settings such as:
Test language
Allowed language
Test language allows you to set the language in which the test will open by default.
Allowed language allows you to set the language in which a candidate can attempt the test.
Output errors
These include errors that occur when the output has:
Only one line but the correct output requires more than one line.
Non-numeric characters, whereas the correct output requires only numeric characters.
Negative numbers, whereas the correct output requires only positive numbers.
Extra empty lines because of printing more new lines '\\n' than expected.
Intermediate spaces
markdown:
# Question settings

You can make settings related to the questions in the tests that you create, in this section.

**Shuffling questions**

Use this option to shuffle the order of questions in a test.

_Important_: This is different from randomizing questions in a test using the question pooling feature.

When you make this setting, it applies to all the questions in the test. It will not have an impact on the options of the MCQs in your test. You can enable this setting under **Proctoring settings**.

**Enabling Cut-off scores**

Use this option to set a recommendation score that will act as an indication for you when you are filtering candidates who have taken a specific test. 

For example, if you set the cut-off score at 90, you can manually filter the scores in the candidate report. This will give you a more realistic number of candidates who you can further evaluate and interview. You can enable this setting under **Cut-off settings**.

**Language settings**

Use this option to make settings such as:

*   Test language
*   Allowed language

**Test language** allows you to set the language in which the test will open by default.

**Allowed language** allows you to set the language in which a candidate can attempt the test.

### **Output errors**

These include errors that occur when the output has:

*   Only one line but the correct output requires more than one line.
*   Non-numeric characters, whereas the correct output requires only numeric characters.
*   Negative numbers, whereas the correct output requires only positive numbers.
*   Extra empty lines because of printing more new lines '\\\\n' than expected.
*   Intermediate spaces

text:
Candidate settings
The feature to add custom details is not available for all the customers. You can contact your account manager to enable this option.
This section allows you to select the details that you want the candidate to provide before starting the test. 
By default, HackerEarth Assessment provides a list of the most common details that can be gathered by recruiters.
Configuring candidate settings 
You can configure candidate settings in two scenarios:
When you are creating a test
When you have created and published a test (live tests)
Important: If you make changes to the candidate settings in a live test, then you will only be able to obtain the details of those candidates who start the test after you have saved the changes.
Configuring candidate settings when you are creating a test
Note: It is assumed that you have already created a test but not published it.
Create a test. 
In the Test details section, click Overview.
In the Overview section, click Candidate settings.
In the Candidate Settings section, select the details that you want candidates to provide. 
By default, Full name and Personal email ID are selected. You can choose to clear the default choices or add more choices from the available categories.
Modifying candidate settings after you have created and published a test
Note: It is assumed that you have already created and published a test.
Log in to your HackerEarth Recruit account using admin credentials.
In the Ongoing Tests section, click the test that you want to modify the candidate settings for.
In the Test Details section, click Overview.
In the Candidate Settings section, select the details that you want the candidate to provide.
By default, Full name and Personal email ID are selected. You can choose to clear the default choices or add more choices from the available categories.
Custom details 
You can also gather custom details from the candidate if required.
You can also gather custom details from the candidate by using auto-generated forms with the following types of fields:
Input: Use this when the information you require is a short phrase or one-line sentence.
Text area: Use this when the information you require has multiple lines of text.
Dropdown: Use this when the information you require must be chosen from a list of options.
Files: Use this when the information you require must be uploaded as a file.
Checkbox: Use this when you require candidates to choose more than one option while providing information.
Adding custom details
Note: It is assumed that you have already created a test but not published it.
In Custom details, click Add new detail.
Click the Detail type dropdown and select the relevant option.
Enter the Detail title. This is a mandatory input.
Enter Detail placeholder. 
Enter Details description. 
Select Required if you want to make this field mandatory.
Click Save.
You have successfully added a custom detail that you want candidates to provide.
markdown:
# Candidate settings

_The feature to add custom details is not available for all the customers. You can contact your account manager to enable this option._

This section allows you to select the details that you want the candidate to provide before starting the test. 

By default, HackerEarth Assessment provides a list of the most common details that can be gathered by recruiters.

![Screenshot_from_2022-12-06_15-26-31.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13217783487257-1.png) Configuring candidate settings

You can configure candidate settings in two scenarios:

*   When you are creating a test
*   When you have created and published a test (live tests)

_Important_: If you make changes to the candidate settings in a live test, then you will only be able to obtain the details of those candidates who start the test after you have saved the changes.

### Configuring candidate settings when you are creating a test

_Note_: It is assumed that you have already created a test but not published it.

1.  Create a test. 
2.  In the **Test details** section, click **Overview**.
3.  In the **Overview** section, click **Candidate settings**.
4.  In the **Candidate Settings** section, select the details that you want candidates to provide.   
    By default, Full name and Personal email ID are selected. You can choose to clear the default choices or add more choices from the available categories.

### Modifying candidate settings after you have created and published a test

**Note**_:_ It is assumed that you have already created and published a test.

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Recruit account using admin credentials.
2.  In the **Ongoing Tests** section, click the test that you want to modify the candidate settings for.
3.  In the **Test Details** section, click **Overview**.
4.  In the **Candidate Settings** section, select the details that you want the candidate to provide.  
    By default, Full name and Personal email ID are selected. You can choose to clear the default choices or add more choices from the available categories.

Custom details

You can also gather custom details from the candidate if required.

You can also gather custom details from the candidate by using auto-generated forms with the following types of fields:

*   Input: Use this when the information you require is a short phrase or one-line sentence.
*   Text area: Use this when the information you require has multiple lines of text.
*   Dropdown: Use this when the information you require must be chosen from a list of options.
*   Files: Use this when the information you require must be uploaded as a file.
*   Checkbox: Use this when you require candidates to choose more than one option while providing information.

### **Adding custom details**

_Note_: It is assumed that you have already created a test but _not_ published it.

1.  In **Custom details**, click **Add new detail**.
2.  Click the **Detail type** dropdown and select the relevant option.  
    ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-31-07-9818-AM.png)
3.  Enter the **Detail title**. This is a mandatory input.
4.  Enter **Detail placeholder**. 
5.  Enter **Details description**.  
6.  Select **Required** if you want to make this field mandatory.
7.  Click **Save**.

You have successfully added a custom detail that you want candidates to provide.

text:
Equal Employment Opportunity compliance
This is a premium feature. To enable this feature, contact support@hackerearth.com.
The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) is a federal agency that administers and enforces civil rights laws against workplace discrimination. EEOC investigates discrimination complaints based on an individual's race, children, national origin, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, and genetic information.
It is also illegal to discriminate against a person because the person complained about discrimination, filed a charge of discrimination, or participated in an employment discrimination investigation or lawsuit.
Now, HackerEarth Assessment and Live interviews are EEO compliant. HackerEarth has always strived to practice fair and unbiased assessments. Therefore, to enhance the candidate experience and ensure fairness in tests or interviews, we have added the following features that make your tests compliant with EEOC guidelines:
Adding EEOC guidelines 
Super admins of your company can edit the company's EEOC statement. To add customized EEOC guidelines that you want your test to be compliant with, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth account by using your admin credentials.
Click Settings.
In the Company section, click EEO compliance.
Enter the title of your Equal Employer Opportunity statement.
Enter the Compliance statement that you want your test to follow.
Click Save Changes.
You have successfully entered the EEOC guidelines that you want your tests to be compliant with.
These statements are displayed to candidates before they enter the test.
Admins of your company can also view these statements at the bottom of a candidate's report.
Suggesting shortlisting guidelines 
HackerEarth displays suggested shortlisting guidelines so that your company is EEO compliant while hiring candidates. To view these guidelines, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth account by using your admin credentials.
Click Tests.
Click the name of the test in which you want to view the shortlisting guidelines.
In the Candidates section, click Test taken.
Note: You can also view these guidelines in Review pending, Shortlisted, and Archived.
Click Click here in the message that is displayed at the bottom of the page.
You can successfully view the suggested guidelines to shortlist candidates.
HackerEarth also displays a popup when you shortlist your first candidate that emphasizes being this shortlist EEO compliant.
Displaying warning messages 
HackerEarth displays a warning message that informs you when you select non-EEO compliant details of candidates that you want them to provide before starting the test. 
This message is displayed in the Candidate settings where you select the details that you want candidates to provide before starting the test.
markdown:
# Equal Employment Opportunity compliance

_This is a premium feature. To enable this feature, contact [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com)._

The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) is a federal agency that administers and enforces civil rights laws against [workplace discrimination](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Workplace_discrimination). EEOC investigates discrimination complaints based on an individual's race, children, national origin, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, and genetic information.

It is also illegal to discriminate against a person because the person complained about discrimination, filed a charge of discrimination, or participated in an employment discrimination investigation or lawsuit.

Now, HackerEarth Assessment and Live interviews are EEO compliant. HackerEarth has always strived to practice fair and unbiased assessments. Therefore, to enhance the candidate experience and ensure fairness in tests or interviews, we have added the following features that make your tests compliant with EEOC guidelines:

Adding EEOC guidelines

Super admins of your company can edit the company's EEOC statement. To add customized EEOC guidelines that you want your test to be compliant with, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth account by using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **Settings.**
    
    **![Screenshot_from_2022-11-28_17-04-06.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12947780447001-Jan-30-2023-11-28-59-8372-AM.png?width=196&height=285&name=12947780447001-Jan-30-2023-11-28-59-8372-AM.png)**
    
3.  In the **Company** section, click **EEO compliance**.
4.  Enter the title of your Equal Employer Opportunity statement.
5.  Enter the **Compliance statement** that you want your test to follow.
6.  Click **Save Changes**.  
    ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-28-58-4592-AM.png)

You have successfully entered the EEOC guidelines that you want your tests to be compliant with.

These statements are displayed to candidates before they enter the test.

![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-29-01-6470-AM.png)

Admins of your company can also view these statements at the bottom of a candidate's report.

![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-28-57-0624-AM.png)

Suggesting shortlisting guidelines

HackerEarth displays suggested shortlisting guidelines so that your company is EEO compliant while hiring candidates. To view these guidelines, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth account by using your admin credentials.
2.  Click Tests.
3.  Click the name of the test in which you want to view the shortlisting guidelines.
4.  In the Candidates section, click Test taken.  
    Note: You can also view these guidelines in Review pending, Shortlisted, and Archived.
5.  Click Click here in the message that is displayed at the bottom of the page.  
    ![mceclip5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-29-05-7738-AM.png)

You can successfully view the suggested guidelines to shortlist candidates.

![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip6-Jan-30-2023-11-29-03-0240-AM.png)

HackerEarth also displays a popup when you shortlist your first candidate that emphasizes being this shortlist EEO compliant.

![mceclip7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-29-04-3866-AM.png)

Displaying warning messages

HackerEarth displays a warning message that informs you when you select non-EEO compliant details of candidates that you want them to provide before starting the test. 

This message is displayed in the [Candidate settings](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002904874-candidate-settings) where you select the details that you want candidates to provide before starting the test.

![mceclip8.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip8-Jan-30-2023-11-29-07-4848-AM.png)

text:
Assessments dashboard
The assessments dashboard allows you to view all the tests (Ongoing, Completed, Drafts, and Archived tests). This page will be displayed when you click on the Administrator dashboard.
S. No.
	
Description
	
1
	
This button redirects you to the Administrator dashboard if you are on some other tab or section.
	
2
	
This button redirects you to the Administrator dashboard.
	
3
	
This button will open up the Assessment Dashboard, where you can see all the ongoing tests, search for any test or tag, and create new tests.
	
4
	
This will redirect you to the FaceCode dashboard, where you can see your interviews or create a new one.
	
5
	
This will show you the HackerEarth Library, where you can view the questions and create new questions in My library.
	
6
	
This allows you to search for a particular candidate by entering their name. and you will get a list of all the tests they have taken before.
	
7
	
This allows you to add admins to the recruit platform.
	
8
	
This allows you to enter any query related to the Recruit platform.
	
9
	
When you click this, the following options will be displayed:
Settings: Change or update your personal and company information. For more information, see Settings.
Billing: Access and complete your billing transactions in HackerEarth Recruit. For more information, see Billing.
Watch help videos: You can check all the help videos on Youtube to understand the platform better
Visit support center: This opens up the homepage of HackerEarth’s help center.
Request a Demo: Click this to request a demo on HackerEarth Recruit
Logout: Click this to exit from your account
	
10
	
This section comprises the following:
Ongoing Tests: These are the tests that are in progress
Completed Tests: These are the tests that are finished
Test Drafts: These are the unpublished tests
Archived Tests: These are the forthcoming tests which are not yet started
	
11
	
You can search for tests by name or tags.
	
12
	
You can create the following types of tests:
Skills
Job role
Job description
Custom
Listed test
	
13
	
You can filter out the results based on tests created by a particular admin.
	
14
	
You can filter out the results based on tests created at a particular time.
	
15
	
You can filter out the results based on the type of test if it is a public or invite-only type.
	
16
	
This will allow you to preview the test from the candidate’s point of view.
	
17
	
This will allow you to invite candidates to the given test.
	
18
	
This will allow you to archive the given test.
	

​_

text:
Personal settings
You can set or update your personal information, change your password, view API details, and manage integrations.
Where can I find the settings?
You can find the personal settings on the HackerEarth Assessments dashboard.
To find personal settings, follow these steps:
1. Log in to your Administrator dashboard.
2. Click the right-most button to open a drop-down list and click Settings.
You can see all the settings in this tab.
What settings can you make here?
Personal information
You can specify your name, job title, and contact number.
For more information, see personal information.
Password
You can change your current password.
For more information, see changing your password.
API details
HackerEarth Recruit API helps you manage tests, candidate invites, and reports on your own with just a few lines of code. To learn more about API details, read this article.
To access the API details, follow these steps:
1. Log in to your Administrator dashboard.
2. Click the right-most button to open a drop-down list and click Settings.
3. Select API details under Personal settings.
You can access the API details as shown in the image.
Important: Your client ID and client secret ID must be kept confidential because they can be misused. It is recommended that you do not share these details with anyone. 
If you do share this information and it is misused, HackerEarth does not take responsibility for the same.
Only super admins and API admins can access this feature.
Integrations
You can integrate your HackerEarth Recruit account with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS). HackerEarth supports different ATS. To learn more, read this article.
Only super admins can access this feature.
For integration requests, please contact your Customer Success Manager.
markdown:
# Personal settings

You can set or update your personal information, change your password, view API details, and manage integrations.

#### **Where can I find the settings?**

You can find the personal settings on the HackerEarth Assessments dashboard.

To find personal settings, follow these steps:

1\. Log in to your Administrator dashboard.

2\. Click the right-most button to open a drop-down list and click **Settings**.

![Screenshot from 2023-09-07 19-20-21](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-20-21.png?width=688&height=129&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-20-21.png)

You can see all the settings in this tab.

![Screenshot from 2023-09-07 16-57-12-1](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2016-57-12-1.png?width=155&height=435&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2016-57-12-1.png)

### **What settings can you make here?**

#### **Personal information**

You can specify your name, job title, and contact number.

For more information, see [personal information.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003371513-setting-your-personal-information)

#### **Password**

You can change your current password.

For more information, see [changing your password.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003178554-changing-your-password)

#### **API details**

HackerEarth Recruit API helps you manage tests, candidate invites, and reports on your own with just a few lines of code. To learn more about API details, read [this article.](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/tests/invite-candidates/)

To access the API details, follow these steps:

1\. Log in to your Administrator dashboard.

2\. Click the right-most button to open a drop-down list and click **Settings**.

![Screenshot from 2023-09-07 19-20-21](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-20-21.png?width=688&height=129&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-20-21.png)

3\. Select **API details** under **Personal settings.**

**![Screenshot from 2023-09-07 16-57-12](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2016-57-12.png?width=148&height=416&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2016-57-12.png)**

You can access the API details as shown in the image.

![Screenshot from 2023-09-07 19-24-20](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-24-20.png?width=682&height=198&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-24-20.png)

_Important:_ Your client ID and client secret ID must be kept confidential because they can be misused. It is recommended that you do not share these details with anyone.  
If you do share this information and it is misused, HackerEarth does not take responsibility for the same.

Only super admins and API admins can access this feature.

#### **Integrations**

You can integrate your HackerEarth Recruit account with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS). HackerEarth supports different ATS. To learn more, read [this article](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360004396114-ats-integrations).

Only super admins can access this feature.

For integration requests, please contact your Customer Success Manager.

text:
Setting a point of contact
You can set a point of contact from the test settings. This contact's email ID will be used to send emails to candidates and receive emails from candidates.
To set a point of contact, follow these steps:
Log into your HackerEarth account using your admin credentials.
Click Assessments.
Select the test for which you want to assign the Point Of Contact.
In the Test admins section, select add admins.
Click on the Admin you want to add as a Point Of Contact.
Click Add.
Under Access control, select All access.
You have successfully set a point of contact.
markdown:
# Setting a point of contact

You can set a point of contact from the [test settings](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002887413-test-settings). This contact's email ID will be used to send emails to candidates and receive emails from candidates.

To set a point of contact, follow these steps:

1.  Log into your HackerEarth account using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **Assessments.**
3.  Select the test for which you want to assign the Point Of Contact.
4.  In the **Test admins** section, select **add admins**.
5.  Click on the Admin you want to add as a **Point Of Contact**.
6.  Click **Add.**
7.  Under **Access control**, select **All access.**

You have successfully set a point of contact.

text:
Administrator dashboard
The administrator dashboard allows you to view your tests, questions library, FaceCode, and ongoing tests.
This page summarizes your account details, including live tests, live interviews, and previously-conducted tests.
This is what the dashboard of your HackerEarth Recruit account looks like:
S. No.
	
Title
	
Explanation
	
1
	
HackerEarth
	
This button redirects you to the Administrator dashboard if you are on some other tab or section.
	
2
	
Dashboard
	
This button redirects you to the Administrator dashboard.
	
3
	
Assessments
	
This button will open up the Assessment dashboard, where you can see all the ongoing tests, search for any test or tag, and create new tests.
	
4
	
FaceCode
	
This will redirect you to the FaceCode dashboard, where you can see your interviews or create a new one.
	
5
	
Library
	
This will show you the HackerEarth Library, where you can view the questions and create new questions in My library.
	
6
	
Search candidates
	
This allows you to search for a particular candidate by entering their name. and you will get a list of all the tests they have taken before.
	
7
	
Add admins
	
This allows you to add admins to the Recruit platform.
	
8
	
Help
	
This allows you to enter any query related to the Recruit platform.
	
9
	
Your name
	
When you click this, the following options will be displayed:
Settings: Change or update your personal and company information. For more information, see Settings.
Billing: Access and complete your billing transactions in HackerEarth Recruit. For more information, see Billing.
Watch help videos: You can check all the help videos on Youtube to understand the platform better
Visit support center: This opens up the homepage of HackerEarth’s help center.
Request a Demo: Click this to request a demo on HackerEarth Recruit
Logout: Click this to exit from your account
	
10
	
Tests
	
Redirects you to the test dashboard
	
11
	
Library
	
Redirects you to the question library
	
12
	
FaceCode
	
Redirects you to the interview interface
	
13
	
Ongoing tests
	
The end date of such tests has not:
Been Specified
Passed
The number of candidates who are currently taking the test and the number of candidates who have completed the test is displayed here.
	
14
	
Ongoing interviews
	
This shows all the FaceCode interviews which have not been completed because of the following:
The interviewer didn’t join
The candidate didn’t join
	
15
	
View candidate report
	
Redirects you to the test dashboard, where you can view the detailed reports of the candidates who have completed your test.
	
16
	
Preview test
	
You can preview the test and see how the test will look from the candidate’s point of view
	
17
	
Invite candidates
	
This allows you to invite candidates directly to the test.

text:
Setting your personal information
To set or update your personal information, follow these steps:
Enter your full name, official email address, job title, and contact number.
Click Save Changes.
You have successfully set or updated your personal information.
Changing your profile picture 
To change your picture, follow these steps:
Click Change Picture.
Navigate to the folder in your system where you have stored your image.
Select the respective image.
Click Open.
You have successfully changed your picture.
Once you have set your picture, you cannot remove it.
Calendar integrations
You can connect to google calendar to receive emails and reminders about tests and interviews on HackerEarth.
For more information, see calendar integrations.
markdown:
# Setting your personal information

To set or update your personal information, follow these steps:

1.  Enter your full name, official email address, job title, and contact number.
2.  Click **Save Changes**.

You have successfully set or updated your personal information.

![Screenshot_from_2022-10-07_15-23-03.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/11268910399257-1.png?width=525&height=339&name=11268910399257-1.png)

### **Changing your profile picture**

To change your picture, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Change Picture**.
2.  Navigate to the folder in your system where you have stored your image.
3.  Select the respective image.
4.  Click **Open**.

You have successfully changed your picture.

Once you have set your picture, you cannot remove it.

### **Calendar integrations**

You can connect to google calendar to receive emails and reminders about tests and interviews on HackerEarth.

For more information, see [calendar integrations.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003338514-integrating-google-calendar)

text:
Changing your password
To change your password, follow these steps:
In the Old Password field, enter your current password.
In the New Password field, enter your new password.
In the Confirm Password field, enter your new password again.
Click Save Changes.
Any of the admins can set or change their personal information and password.
You have successfully changed your password.
markdown:
# Changing your password

To change your password, follow these steps:

1.  In the **Old Password** field, enter your current password.
2.  In the **New Password** field, enter your new password.
3.  In the **Confirm Password** field, enter your new password again.
4.  Click **Save Changes**.

Any of the admins can set or change their personal information and password.

You have successfully changed your password.

text:
Sending the Shortlist and Archive emails to candidates
HackerEarth has enabled a feature to send emails to candidates about their evaluation status. If candidates are shortlisted or rejected, then they receive these emails.
Note: This feature is enabled for all the customers. 
To send emails to candidates about their evaluation status, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth account by using your admin credentials.
Click Tests.
Click the tests in which you want to send emails to candidates.
Note: You can send the Shortlist and Archived emails from Ongoing and Completed tests.
If you want to send emails to shortlisted candidates about their evaluation status, then: 
Click Shortlisted under the Candidates section.
Select the candidates to whom you want to send the email.
Click Send email.
Click Yes to send the Shortlist email.

Note
1. You can send emails to multiple selected candidates or all the candidates who are shortlisted.
2. Click Send email to all to send the email to all the shortlisted candidates.
A confirmation message is being displayed on the platform when the email is sent.
If you want to send emails to archived candidates about their evaluation status, then: 
Click Archived under the Candidates section.
Select the candidates who you want to send the email.
Click Send email.
Click Yes to send the Archived email.

Note
1. You can send emails to multiple selected candidates or all the candidates who are archived.
2. Click Send email to all to send the email to all the archived candidates.
A confirmation message is being displayed on the platform when the email is sent.
You have successfully sent the emails to candidates.
markdown:
# Sending the Shortlist and Archive emails to candidates

HackerEarth has enabled a feature to send emails to candidates about their evaluation status. If candidates are shortlisted or rejected, then they receive these emails.

**Note**: This feature is enabled for all the customers. 

To send emails to candidates about their evaluation status, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth account by using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **Tests**.
3.  Click the tests in which you want to send emails to candidates.  
    **Note**: You can send the Shortlist and Archived emails from **Ongoing** and **Completed** tests.
4.  If you want to send emails to shortlisted candidates about their evaluation status, then:
    1.  Click **Shortlisted** under the Candidates section.  
        ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-47-17-6181-AM.png)
    2.  Select the candidates to whom you want to send the email.
    3.  Click **Send email**.  
        ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-47-16-3593-AM.png)
    4.  Click **Yes** to send the Shortlist email.  
        ![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-47-14-0661-AM.png)  
        **Note  
        **1\. You can send emails to multiple selected candidates or all the candidates who are shortlisted.  
        2\. Click **Send email to all** to send the email to all the shortlisted candidates.
        
        A confirmation message is being displayed on the platform when the email is sent.  
        ![mceclip5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-47-20-1111-AM.png)
        
5.  If you want to send emails to archived candidates about their evaluation status, then:
    1.  Click **Archived** under the **Candidates** section.  
        ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-47-21-3484-AM.png)
    2.  Select the candidates who you want to send the email.
    3.  Click **Send email**.  
        ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-47-24-5215-AM.png)
    4.  Click **Yes** to send the Archived email.  
        ![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip6-Jan-30-2023-11-47-18-9512-AM.png)  
        **Note  
        **1\. You can send emails to multiple selected candidates or all the candidates who are archived.  
        2\. Click **Send email to all** to send the email to all the archived candidates.
        
        A confirmation message is being displayed on the platform when the email is sent.  
        ![mceclip7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-47-22-5142-AM.png)
        

You have successfully sent the emails to candidates.

text:
Candidate status
To view the status of a candidate, follow these steps:
Log in to HackerEarth Recruit using the admin credentials.
Click Assessments.
Click the name of the test to know the candidate's status.
In the Candidates section, you will see the following:
Test taken
Review pending
Shortlisted
Archived
Currently taking
Invited
S. No.	Title	Description	
1	Test taken	
Candidates who have finished the test.
	
2	Review pending	Candidates who have taken the test but the review of the test is still pending.	
3	Shortlisted	
Candidates who have passed the test and are shortlisted by the recruiter.
	
4	Archived	
Candidates who are rejected or have underperformed in the test.
	
5	Currently taking	
Candidates who are taking the test at the present time
Note: This status is available only while candidates are taking a test.
This status will not be available after all the candidates complete the test. 
	
6	Invited	Candidates who are invited to take the test through email.
markdown:
# Candidate status To view the status of a candidate, follow these steps: 1. Log in to HackerEarth Recruit using the admin credentials. 2. Click **Assessments**. 3. Click the name of the test to know the candidate's status. 4. In the **Candidates** section, you will see the following: 1. Test taken 2. Review pending 3. Shortlisted 4. Archived 5. Currently taking 6. Invited ![Screenshot_from_2022-11-30_15-54-07.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13018847012377-3.png) | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | **S. No.** | **Title** | **Description** | | 1 | Test taken | Candidates who have finished the test. | | 2 | Review pending | Candidates who have taken the test but the review of the test is still pending. | | 3 | Shortlisted | Candidates who have passed the test and are shortlisted by the recruiter. | | 4 | Archived | Candidates who are rejected or have underperformed in the test. | | 5 | Currently taking | Candidates who are taking the test at the present time

Note: This status is available only while candidates are taking a test.

This status will not be available after all the candidates complete the test. | | 6 | Invited | Candidates who are invited to take the test through email. |

markdown:
# ATS integrations

HackerEarth Assessment is integrated with the following Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS):

*   [Greenhouse](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#greenhouse)
*   [Linkedin Talent Hub](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#linkedin-talent-hub)
*   [Lever](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#lever)
*   [iCIMS](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#icims)
*   [Workable](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#workable)
*   [JazzHR](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#jazzhr)
*   [SAP SuccessFactors](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#successfactors)
*   [Jobvite](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#jobvite)
*   [Eightfold](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#eightfold)
*   [Zoho Recruit](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#zoho-recruit)
*   [Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#recruiterbox-trakstar-hire)
*   [SmartRecruiters](https://help.hackerearth.com/assessments-ats-integrations#smartrecruiters)

These integrations allow a recruiter to conduct tests on the HackerEarth Recruit platform without leaving the ATS that they are using to track applicants.

Some of the ATS integrations are also integrated with FaceCode. The given table will tell you about our current ATS integrations with both FaceCode and Assessments.

![Screenshot from 2023-03-13 15-54-46](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-13%2015-54-46.png?width=688&height=511&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-13%2015-54-46.png)

**Features**

These features can be used in all the ATS that are integrated with HackerEarth Recruit.

Recruiters can do the following:

These tasks can be completed only if the tests are published and the recruiter is using the same email ID that is used to log in to the ATS.

*   Can view tests created by the admin
*   View tests that the admin is part of
*   Check the status of a candidate with respect to a specific test
*   Invite candidates for tests
*   View a candidate’s report for a specific test

text:
Reset the test
The reset test option allows you to reset the test for the candidates.
Note: This is not applicable to candidates who have not started the test yet.
To reset the test for candidates, follow these steps:
Log into HackerEarth Recruit using your admin credentials.
Click Tests.
Important: You can extend the test duration only for ongoing or completed tests.
Select the test for which you want to extend the test duration.
Under the Candidates section, click Test taken.
Click Reset test.
Select the candidates whose test reset. There are two categories of candidates:
All candidates: All the candidates who are invited to take the test.
Specific candidates: You can reset the test for specific candidates.
Important: If you select this option, you must enter the email IDs of the specific candidates.
Click Reset now.
A pop-up will show asking for confirmation to reset the test. Click Yes.
You will receive a notification confirming that the test has been reset.
markdown:
# Reset the test

The reset test option allows you to reset the test for the candidates.

_Note_: This is not applicable to candidates who have not started the test yet.

To reset the test for candidates, follow these steps:

1.  Log into HackerEarth Recruit using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **Tests.**

1.  _Important_: You can extend the test duration only for ongoing or completed tests.

1.  Select the test for which you want to extend the test duration.
2.  Under the **Candidates** section, click **Test taken**.
3.  Click **Reset test.**  
    ![](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/jxerhOyGo-NjQEDSSJREVJ-qPwtTJKIxh2wyqo18m59teeC5b0tTe8el6NjCJ9nmY4J9HFHvdhKDvVhS-EBWjvbjbvCpjrIqy-8svrAeWKE_iNDoR-Y5h1-vaeIW1ObJeNHzQxKaFNokkZ0OOXXZkjM)
4.  Select the candidates whose test reset. There are two categories of candidates:

*   **All candidates**: All the candidates who are invited to take the test.

![](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/AbLquK0T3FGu-QLtvo8wEr_BKRKBO__HdhwzVst5c8QclokLyasgj0T8GhdmfXWbnB-Z7kDXXtvi0PXfLHtCgtU0p8cZTIQSCsaPSoBQV2ssNZBjRDR-PmSsSw-FMzl4ZVsR_KuYGzG6ANO8F685X2w)

*   **Specific candidates**: You can reset the test for specific candidates.

*   _Important_: If you select this option, you must enter the email IDs of the specific candidates.

1.  Click **Reset now.**
2.  A pop-up will show asking for confirmation to reset the test. Click **Yes**.

![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/jrzBJ7-NwzYLQ_zONqMjZMA_canCo07GCD-w3sPMCh1tqGFHQV7yj12az_E1pxfrIDlMDMzDVyzgfA6W7Z6l39WfBvO1R4_k_E-56_3Y608k3sVLjsTu2XbH_6K52WwssgaWwK9pkAwv0fEoSGXUcXs)

You will receive a notification confirming that the test has been reset.

text:
Company settings
Company settings allow you to change information about your company, add or remove team members, manage payment methods, and set the language of the dashboard.
Where can I find these settings?
You can find the personal settings on the HackerEarth Recruit dashboard.
To find the company settings, follow these steps:

2. Click Billings and Settings at the top right of the dashboard.
3. Click Settings. 
You will find all the settings on the page.
What settings can you make here?
Company information
You can see the information about your company here. This is the same information that was provided when you bought your HackerEarth Recruit subscription. 
For more information, see Company information.
Team Members
You can view team members, add team members, assign roles, and manage team members here.

Payment

Language

Company languages: Set the language in which your dashboard must be opened initially

markdown:
# Company settings

Company settings allow you to change information about your company, add or remove team members, manage payment methods, and set the language of the dashboard.

### **Where can I find these settings?**

You can find the personal settings on the HackerEarth Recruit dashboard.

To find the company settings, follow these steps:

1\. Go to HackerEarth's Assessment dashboard.

2\. Click **Billings and Settings** at the top right of the dashboard**.**

**![Screenshot_from_2022-10-06_16-28-17.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/11234389597721-1.png?width=234&height=250&name=11234389597721-1.png)**

3\. Click **Settings.** 

You will find all the settings on the page.

### **What settings can you make here?**

#### **Company information**

You can see the information about your company here. This is the same information that was provided when you bought your HackerEarth Recruit subscription.

For more information, see [Company information.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003408193-company-information)

#### **Team Members**

You can view team members, add team members, assign roles, and manage team members here.

For more information, see [Team members.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003388274-creating-teams-and-adding-admins)

#### **Payment**

You can add, view, and manage payment methods here.

1.  Click ![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-42-48-1744-AM.png?width=28&height=27&name=mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-42-48-1744-AM.png) on the administrator dashboard.
2.  Click **Settings**. 
3.  In the **COMPANY** section, click **Payment**.
4.  Click **Add New Payment Method**.

![Screenshot_from_2022-10-06_16-31-04.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/11234496223129-1.png)

**For more information, see [Billing.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003154993-billing)**

#### **Language**

You can set the language of your choice here.

*   Company languages: Set the language in which your dashboard must be opened initially
*   Allowed languages: Set the languages in which you can toggle and view the dashboard

For more information, see [Language settings](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003398514-language-settings).

#### **Terms of use**

You can define the terms and conditions of your company which will be visible to the candidates before the assessment. 

For more information, see Adding [company-specific Terms of Use](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900004668343-adding-company-specific-terms-of-use).

text:
Creating a timed MCQ
By default, there is no time limit within which a candidate must answer an MCQ. However, you can set the time limit for a specific MCQ in your test. This feature makes that specific MCQ a timed MCQ, which means that the candidate must answer the question within the time limit that is set. If the candidate does not answer the question within the time limit that is set, then they will not be able to attempt the question again.
To create a timed MCQ, follow these steps:
Note: It is assumed that you have created a test.
Open your test.
In the Test Details section of your test, click Questions.
In the Multiple Choice Questions section, click the MCQ for which you want to set the time limit. 
Imp: You can set the time limit in seconds only.
Click Edit question.
Select Make this a timed question.
Enter the Maximum time in seconds.
Click Publish changes.
A confirmation notification is displayed on the screen.
You have successfully set the maximum time limit for a multiple-choice question. 
The question is displayed as a timed question in a test. To answer the question, the candidate must click Load question. 
Once Load question is clicked, the timer starts and the candidate must answer the question before the timer stops.
If candidates do not answer the question before the timer stops, they will not be able to attempt the question again.
markdown:
# Creating a timed MCQ

By default, there is no time limit within which a candidate must answer an MCQ. However, you can set the time limit for a specific MCQ in your test. This feature makes that specific MCQ a timed MCQ, which means that the candidate must answer the question within the time limit that is set. If the candidate does not answer the question within the time limit that is set, then they will not be able to attempt the question again.

To create a timed MCQ, follow these steps:

**Note**: It is assumed that you have created a test.

1.  Open your test.
2.  In the **Test Details** section of your test, click **Questions**.
3.  In the **Multiple Choice Questions** section, click the MCQ for which you want to set the time limit.   
    **Imp**: You can set the time limit in seconds only.
4.  Click **Edit question**.
5.  Select **Make this a timed question**.  
    ![Screenshot_from_2022-12-06_15-11-08.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13217423943961-1.png?width=238&height=342&name=13217423943961-1.png)
6.  Enter the **Maximum time** in seconds.
7.  Click **Publish changes**.

A confirmation notification is displayed on the screen.  
![Screenshot_from_2022-12-06_15-15-45.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13217516201881-1.png?width=261&height=42&name=13217516201881-1.png)

You have successfully set the maximum time limit for a multiple-choice question. 

The question is displayed as a timed question in a test. To answer the question, the candidate must click **Load question**. 

![Screenshot_from_2022-12-06_15-19-41.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13217559319449-1.png)

Once **Load question** is clicked, the timer starts and the candidate must answer the question before the timer stops.

![Screenshot_from_2022-12-06_15-21-01.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13217599961369-1.png?width=151&height=30&name=13217599961369-1.png)

If candidates do not answer the question before the timer stops, they will not be able to attempt the question again.

# Setting up your account

*   [Company settings](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003337694-company-settings)

### Personal settings

You can set or update the following settings:

*   [Personal information](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003371513-setting-your-personal-information)
*   Email preferences
*   [Password](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003178554-changing-your-password)
*   API details
*   [Integrations](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360004396114-ats-integrations)  
    

### Company settings

You can set or update the following settings:

*   [Company information](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003408193-company-information)
*   [Team management](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003388274-creating-teams-and-adding-admins)
*   SSO settings
*   [Payment](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003418833-adding-a-payment-method)
*   [Language](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003398514-language-settings)
*   Diversity and Inclusion
*   [Terms of Use](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900004668343-adding-company-specific-terms-of-use)
*   EEO compliance

markdown:
# Text form

This is used for large lines of text. For example, if you are conducting an offline hiring challenge, you can use this to collect information such as:

*   Alternate address
*   Brief about the candidate
*   CV
*   Covering letter

## **Field descriptions**

### **Field title**

Specify what the field is for

### **Field placeholder**

Sample text that gives the candidate an example of the type of information you require

### **Field description**

Explanation of the field title to give the candidate a hint about the kind of information that must be entered in the field

### **Required**

Select this option to make it mandatory to fill the form

# Deleting sections

You can delete a section if required.

text:
Reliability of the test
The reliability of a test can be defined as the measure of how consistent your test is in measuring a candidate's technical skills accurately. If a test is reliable, it has good questions, making it a good assessment to test candidates' skills.
To calculate the reliability of a test, the following conditions should be fulfilled:
A minimum of 50 candidates should have taken the test
A minimum of 10 questions should be in the test
What makes a question good?
A question in a test becomes a good question when it accurately assesses a candidate's technical skills. For example, a good question contains proper language and implementation of the concept the question is based on.
What makes a question bad?
The following things make a question bad:
The content of the question is not proper or clear. This includes the following: 
The language of the question might be confusing. 
The test cases of the question might not be clear.
The code stubs might be wrong.
There might be some missing libraries or dependencies in the question.
The test is too difficult for the candidates.
The test questions and the candidates' skills do not match, which means that the candidates do not have the skills to solve the questions asked in the test.
The test is taken by too few candidates.
It is recommended to delete or hide such questions from the test.
markdown:
# Reliability of the test

The reliability of a test can be defined as the measure of how consistent your test is in measuring a candidate's technical skills accurately. If a test is reliable, it has good questions, making it a good assessment to test candidates' skills.

To calculate the reliability of a test, the following conditions should be fulfilled:

*   A minimum of 50 candidates should have taken the test
*   A minimum of 10 questions should be in the test

### What makes a question good?

A question in a test becomes a good question when it accurately assesses a candidate's technical skills. For example, a good question contains proper language and implementation of the concept the question is based on.

### What makes a question bad?

The following things make a question bad:

1.  The content of the question is not proper or clear. This includes the following: 

*   The language of the question might be confusing. 
*   The test cases of the question might not be clear.
*   The code stubs might be wrong.
*   There might be some missing libraries or dependencies in the question.

3.  The test is too difficult for the candidates.
4.  The test questions and the candidates' skills do not match, which means that the candidates do not have the skills to solve the questions asked in the test.
5.  The test is taken by too few candidates.

It is recommended to delete or hide such questions from the test.

metadata.title: Extending the test duration for candidates
metadata.description: The Extend time option allows you to give candidates extra time (apart from the original test duration) to complete their tests. Note: This is not applicable to candidates who have not started the tes

openGraph.content: The Extend time option allows you to give candidates extra time (apart from the original test duration) to complete their tests. Note: This is not applicable to candidates who have not started the tes
Extending the test duration for candidates

text:
Extending the test duration for candidates
The Extend time option allows you to give candidates extra time (apart from the original test duration) to complete their tests.
Note: This is not applicable to candidates who have not started the test yet.
To extend the time for candidates, follow these steps:
Log into HackerEarth Recruit using your admin credentials.
Click Tests.
Important: You can extend the test duration only for ongoing or completed tests.
Select the test for which you want to extend the test duration.
Under the Candidates section, click Test taken.
Click Extend time.
Select the candidates whose test duration you want to extend. There are three categories of candidates:
1. For online candidates: The candidates who are currently taking the test.
Important: This will only be visible when the test is live and being taken by the candidates.
2. For all candidates: All the candidates who are invited to take the test.
Important: If you select any one of these options, the text box to enter email IDs is disabled.
3. For specific candidates: You can extend the time for specific candidates.
Important: If you select this option, you must enter the email IDs of the specific candidates.
7. Enter the extra time (in minutes) that you want your test to extend for.
8. Click Extend duration.
You will receive a notification confirming the extension of the test duration. 
Note: You cannot extend the test duration if you select For online candidates, but the candidate is offline.
The candidates whose test duration is extended receive an email on their registered email IDs from the HackerEarth Support Team.
markdown:
# Extending the test duration for candidates

The Extend time option allows you to give candidates extra time (apart from the original test duration) to complete their tests.

_Note_: This is not applicable to candidates who have not started the test yet.

To extend the time for candidates, follow these steps:

1.  Log into HackerEarth Recruit using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **Tests**.
    
    _Important_: You can extend the test duration only for ongoing or completed tests.
    

3.  Select the test for which you want to extend the test duration.
4.  Under the **Candidates** section, click **Test taken**.
5.  Click **Extend time**.  
    ![Screenshot_from_2022-12-15_16-53-03.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13537840316825-1.png)
6.  Select the candidates whose test duration you want to extend. There are three categories of candidates:

1\. **For online candidates**: The candidates who are currently taking the test.

_Important_: This will only be visible when the test is live and being taken by the candidates.

2. **For all candidates**: All the candidates who are invited to take the test.

_Important_: If you select any one of these options, the text box to enter email IDs is disabled.

![Screenshot_from_2022-12-15_16-54-13.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13537851883417-1.png?width=525&height=381&name=13537851883417-1.png)

3. **For specific candidates**: You can extend the time for specific candidates.

_Important_: If you select this option, you must enter the email IDs of the specific candidates.

7\. Enter the extra time (in minutes) that you want your test to extend for.

8\. Click **Extend duration**.

You will receive a notification confirming the extension of the test duration. 

_Note_: You cannot extend the test duration if you select **For online candidates**, but the candidate is offline.

The candidates whose test duration is extended receive an email on their registered email IDs from the HackerEarth Support Team.
