markdown:
# Types of plan

HackerEarth provides you with the following types of plan:

1.  Startup plan
2.  Enterprise plan
3.  Custom plan

## Startup plan

*   Auto-generated tests
*   Password protected tests
*   HackerEarth question library
*   Export and share test reports
*   View candidate feedback
*   Custom question library
*   Basic proctoring options

The plan provides you with **20 test invites** and allows you to have **1 admin** for the test.

## Enterprise plan

*   Everything that the Startup plan offers
*   Advanced proctoring options
*   Question sections
*   White labeling options
*   Bulk upload MCQ questions
*   Code Player
*   HackerEarth Recruit API

The plan provides you with **50 test invites** and allows you to have **2 admins** for the test.

## Custom plan

*   Dedicated account manager
*   Everything that the Enterprise plan offers
*   Third-party ATS integration
*   24/7 Phone and Email support

The number of invites for this plan depends on your **custom choice**.

For more information on pricing, visit [this link](https://www.hackerearth.com/recruit/pricing/).

metadata.title: Plagiarism insights
metadata.description: This feature is especially useful in the following scenarios: You will see 2 panels in the plagiarism report in which each panel is the code written by the two candidates. The color code is as follows

openGraph.content: This feature is especially useful in the following scenarios: You will see 2 panels in the plagiarism report in which each panel is the code written by the two candidates. The color code is as follows

text:
Plagiarism insights
Important : You must be an admin to be able to request a plagiarism report. 
This feature is especially useful in the following scenarios:
A number of candidates are taking the test together. For example, during a recruitment drive on the company premises
Internal evaluations are conducted. For example, for LnD or for internal engagement
What happens when a request is made?
The platform compares the submissions made by a candidate with the submissions made by all the other candidates. 
Each line of the code is compared. If any 2 submissions match more than 70%, the submissions are flagged and the names of both the candidates are mentioned in the plagiarism report. 
Note: This is the case even if a candidate has copied from more than 2 candidates. 
What does a plagiarism report look like?
Your report will be color coded. 
Color log
You will see 2 panels in the plagiarism report in which each panel is the code written by the two candidates. The color code is as follows: 
No color: When the code is not highlighted, it means that it is an exact copy.
Yellow: Yellow highlights indicate a slight match. This is common when candidates change variable names but do not change the plagiarized logic 
Red and green: These colors indicate that the code written by both the candidates is not the same.
markdown:
# Plagiarism insights

_Important_ : You must be an admin to be able to request a plagiarism report.

This feature is especially useful in the following scenarios:

*   A number of candidates are taking the test together. For example, during a recruitment drive on the company premises
*   Internal evaluations are conducted. For example, for LnD or for internal engagement

## **What happens when a request is made?**

The platform compares the submissions made by a candidate with the submissions made by all the other candidates.

Each line of the code is compared. If any 2 submissions match more than 70%, the submissions are flagged and the names of both the candidates are mentioned in the plagiarism report.

_Note:_ This is the case even if a candidate has copied from more than 2 candidates.

## **What does a plagiarism report look like?**

Your report will be color coded.

![plagiarism_report.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/plagiarism_report-1.png?width=741&height=329&name=plagiarism_report-1.png)

### **Color log**

You will see 2 panels in the plagiarism report in which each panel is the code written by the two candidates. The color code is as follows: 

_No color_: When the code is not highlighted, it means that it is an exact copy.

_Yellow_: Yellow highlights indicate a slight match. This is common when candidates change variable names but do not change the plagiarized logic 

_Red and green_: These colors indicate that the code written by both the candidates is not the same.

# Deleting your payment method

1.  Log in to Recruit using the admin credentials.
2.  Click **Billing**.

_Important_: You cannot delete all your payment methods. One payment method must be added at all times.

headers.set-cookie:
__cf_bm=Rx8ofDDhx4mxpwjw1WpA_5hMydCPPXDSbF7fGvfbNxE-1719137847-1.0.1.1-FFUZXTNfA4uUFgG9ETtUx2HiM0HC0B1iItdj2JdNSSGFaUpEjE.aG7YA2x0HYGFCdj.XxviaEucHnTInEzKpMQ; path=/; expires=Sun, 23-Jun-24 10:47:27 GMT; domain=.help.hackerearth.com; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None
__cfruid=7d2f07b9f1043e6eacfba36dc2f97bf38cbd6ec6-1719137847; path=/; domain=.help.hackerearth.com; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None

text:
What is FaceCode?
FaceCode is an interviewing platform that you can use to conduct live, technical interviews.
Key features
Some of the key features of FaceCode include the following:
Important: 'Participants' refers to the candidates and interviewers collectively.
Interview scheduling
The interviewers can schedule interviews directly based on their performance from the Active under Candidates section on the Tests page. 
Calendar integration
The interviews can be integrated with the Google calendar of candidates.
Important: The candidates should have a working account on HackerEarth and it should be connected to the Google calendar.
Emails
HackerEarth sends different emails to the participants when an interview is:
Scheduled
Rescheduled
Canceled 
Live Interviews list in the Recruit dashboard
The interviewers can see the live interviews on the HackerEarth Recruit dashboard.
Default system check
The candidates' system is automatically checked for the following:
Versions of the operating system and browser
Whether JavaScript is enabled
Dimensions of the screen size that is being used
Whether cookies are enabled
Whether the candidate's webcam and microphone/speaker is working
Live video streaming
Candidates and interviewers can broadcast live video by using a working webcam and a computer with a working Internet connection. They can view and switch between each other's screens.
Interview Questions
The interviewers can add, edit, or remove questions from an interview. The questions can be added manually or from the interviewer's custom library (My Library). For more information, see Adding questions to your interview.
Collaborative code editing
Interviewers can see the candidates write code in real time and evaluate the approach that they use to solve a problem. 
Diagram board
Participants can use this collaborative board to ask or explain the flow of the code or any other diagram-specific questions related to flow diagrams or UML. You can also use the diagram board to ask system design questions to the candidate to assess the candidate's skill of understanding complex systems. You can use the diagram board for asking text-based questions too.
Separate candidate and interviewer chat rooms
Participants can communicate with each other through instant messaging. While all the interviewers can view the Candidate's chat room, the candidate cannot view the Interviewer(s) chat room.
Interviewer chat room
Candidate chat room
Notifications
A notification appears when the following actions are completed:
Interviewers add, edit, or delete questions
Candidates attempt any question
Candidates compile their code
Interviewers change the language in which the candidate must write the code for a question
Interview is complete
Code compilation with custom input
The candidates can compile their code with the sample input provided for the question. 
Interview feedback with the rating
The interviewers can give feedback and rating based on the candidates' performance.
Multiple sessions are not allowed
The candidates cannot appear in the same interview from multiple sessions. The system asks the candidates to log out from other sessions so that they can continue from a specific session.

.
markdown:
# What is FaceCode?

FaceCode is an interviewing platform that you can use to conduct live, technical interviews.

### **Key features**

Some of the key features of FaceCode include the following:

_Important_: 'Participants' refers to the candidates and interviewers collectively.

#### **Interview scheduling**

The interviewers can schedule interviews directly based on their performance from the Active under Candidates section on the Tests page.   
![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-31-53-9033-AM.png)

#### **Calendar integration**

The interviews can be integrated with the Google calendar of candidates.

_Important_: The candidates should have a working account on HackerEarth and it should be connected to the Google calendar.

#### **Emails**

HackerEarth sends different emails to the participants when an interview is:

*   Scheduled
*   Rescheduled
*   Canceled 

#### **Live Interviews list in the Recruit dashboard**

The interviewers can see the live interviews on the HackerEarth Recruit dashboard.

#### **Default system check**

The candidates' system is automatically checked for the following:

1.  Versions of the operating system and browser
2.  Whether JavaScript is enabled
3.  Dimensions of the screen size that is being used
4.  Whether cookies are enabled
5.  Whether the candidate's webcam and microphone/speaker is working

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-31-49-7878-AM.png)  

#### **Live video streaming**

Candidates and interviewers can broadcast live video by using a working webcam and a computer with a working Internet connection. They can view and switch between each other's screens.

#### **Interview Questions**

The interviewers can add, edit, or remove questions from an interview. The questions can be added manually or from the interviewer's custom library (My Library). For more information, see [Adding questions to your interview](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007131153-adding-questions-to-your-interview).

#### **Collaborative code editing**

Interviewers can see the candidates write code in real time and evaluate the approach that they use to solve a problem. 

#### **Diagram board**

Participants can use this collaborative board to ask or explain the flow of the code or any other diagram-specific questions related to flow diagrams or UML. You can also use the diagram board to ask system design questions to the candidate to assess the candidate's skill of understanding complex systems. You can use the diagram board for asking text-based questions too.

![Screenshot_from_2023-01-06_11-41-40.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14260441563929-1.png)

#### **Separate candidate and interviewer chat rooms**

Participants can communicate with each other through instant messaging. While all the interviewers can view the **Candidate's** chat room, the candidate cannot view the **Interviewer(s)** chat room.

**Interviewer chat room**

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-31-52-4600-AM.png)

**Candidate chat room**

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-31-55-0690-AM.png)

#### **Notifications**

A notification appears when the following actions are completed:

*   Interviewers add, edit, or delete questions
*   Candidates attempt any question
*   Candidates compile their code
*   Interviewers change the language in which the candidate must write the code for a question
*   Interview is complete

#### **Code compilation with custom input**

The candidates can compile their code with the sample input provided for the question. 

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-31-57-9660-AM.png)

#### **Interview feedback with the rating**

The interviewers can give feedback and rating based on the candidates' performance.

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-31-56-5034-AM.png)

#### **Multiple sessions are not allowed**

The candidates cannot appear in the same interview from multiple sessions. The system asks the candidates to log out from other sessions so that they can continue from a specific session.

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-31-59-5665-AM.png)  
.

text:
FaceCode minimum system requirements
A candidate's system must meet the system-compatibility requirements for attempting a test and taking the live interview. Hence, the candidates' system is automatically checked for the following:
Versions of the operating system and browser
Whether JavaScript is enabled that is being used
Whether cookies are enabled
Dimensions of the screen size
Whether the candidate's webcam and microphone/speaker is working
markdown:
# FaceCode minimum system requirements

A candidate's system must meet the system-compatibility requirements for attempting a test and taking the live interview. Hence, the candidates' system is automatically checked for the following:

1.  Versions of the operating system and browser
2.  Whether JavaScript is enabled that is being used
3.  Whether cookies are enabled
4.  Dimensions of the screen size
5.  Whether the candidate's webcam and microphone/speaker is working

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-35-24-5500-AM.png)

metadata.title: Adding your primary payment method
metadata.description: The credit card that you make your primary payment method will be used for all future transactions.

openGraph.content: The credit card that you make your primary payment method will be used for all future transactions.

text:
Adding your primary payment method
Log in to Recruit using admin credentials.
Click Billing.
In the Payment section, enter the following information:
In the Credit Card Number field, enter the number of your credit card.
In the Cardholder’s Name field, enter the name of the person who owns the credit card.
In the Card Expiry list, select the month and year in which the credit card will expire.
In the Billing Address field, enter the address to which you want your bill sent.
Select Mark this card as primary to make this card your primary payment method.
The credit card that you make your primary payment method will be used for all future transactions.
Was this article helpful? 
Related articles
Deleting your payment method
Format for adding MCQs in bulk
Changing your existing payment method
Troubleshooting camera permissions
Adding yourself to a team
markdown:
# Adding your primary payment method

1.  Log in to Recruit using admin credentials.
2.  Click **Billing**.
3.  In the **Payment** section, enter the following information:  
    1.  In the **Credit Card Number** field, enter the number of your credit card.
    2.  In the **Cardholder’s Name** field, enter the name of the person who owns the credit card.
    3.  In the **Card Expiry** list, select the month and year in which the credit card will expire.
    4.  In the **Billing Address** field, enter the address to which you want your bill sent.
    5.  Select **Mark this card as primary** to make this card your primary payment method.

The credit card that you make your primary payment method will be used for all future transactions.

###### 

Was this article helpful?

### Related articles

openGraph.content: To view the interview interface, follow these steps: Your interview interface will be displayed as follows:  S. No. Title Description 1 Add questions  You can do the following: 2 Switch tabs This butt

text:
Interview interface
To view the interview interface, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.
Click FaceCode.
In the Ongoing section, click the name of the interview. For example, Java Interview.
Your interview interface will be displayed as follows:
S. No.
	
Title
	
Description
	
1
	
Add questions 
	
You can do the following:
Add a question
Choose from Library
Import question from test 
	
2
	
Switch tabs
	
This button allows you to switch tabs to go to the next tab.
	
3
	
Diagram board
	
This is a diagram board that the interview participants can use to explain the working of code, approach, or any other diagram-specific questions.
	
4
	
Programming language 
	
The candidates can select the programming language in which they want to code from the drop-down list.
	
5
	
Run
	
This button is used to run the program for sample test cases.
	
6
	
Quick test
	
This allows you to enter the custom input to quickly check the output for the code.
	
7
	
Output
	
This shows the output screen contains the output, compilation log, and errors (if any). 
	
8
	
Sample program
	
This is an automatically-populated program. Its format changes according to the programming language selected by the candidate.
	
9
	
Live video streaming
	
This allows the candidate and interviewers to see each other during the interview.
	
10
	
Audio/Video
	
This allows you to turn on/off audio or video during the interview.
	
11
	
Request screen share
	
This allows you to request the candidates to share their screens during the interview.
	
12
	
Interview features
	
These include the following:
Notes: You can write notes during the interview.
Score: You can give scores to the candidate according to their performance. 
Chats: You can chat with the candidate or among the other interviewers.
People: You can see the people present in the interview
Invite: This allows the participants to copy the link and share it with the candidate and other interviewers so that they can access the interview.
	
13
	
More
	
This contains the candidate's information.
	
14
	
Timer
	
This signifies Interview time.
	
15
	
End Interview
	
This allows you to end the interview.

text:
Audio and video recording of interviews
This is a premium feature. To enable this feature for your account, contact us at support@hackerearth.com.
We always aim to provide the best user experience to recruiters. Therefore, HackerEarth Live Interview now supports the feature of recording the audio and video of interviews. 
The advantages of this feature are as follows:
One of the primary benefits of recording an interview (audio or video) is that it allows the interviewer to concentrate on the interview rather than writing notes, which can act as a distraction to both the interviewee and the person(s) asking the questions.
Recorded interviews allow the candidates and interviewers to develop and foster a better relationship and rapport during the interview that led to the candidate providing more detailed and in-depth information.
In addition to fostering a more positive, interactive, and informative discussion during the interview, audio and video recording also improve the quality and transparency of the provided information.
It also offers the advantage of providing feedback about the interviewers' techniques and ensuring more informative and productive interviews in the future.
Steps
To record the audio and video of your scheduled interviews, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account by using the admin credentials.
Click FaceCode.
Now, schedule a new interview or go to the Ongoing interviews section. To know more about how to schedule new interviews, click here.
Click the name of the interview.
As soon as you are redirected to the Interview interface, the Share your screen dialog box appears on the screen asking permission to share your entire screen, application window, or Chrome tab.
Select the displayed window in the box and click Share.
You have successfully started the recording of the interview. To stop the sharing of your screen, click Stop sharing which is available at the bottom of your screen.
If you click Cancel, then the video screen recording of the interview does not occur. However, the audio of the interview and the members' physical environment are recorded from the webcam.
markdown:
# Audio and video recording of interviews

_This is a premium feature. To enable this feature for your account, contact us at **support@hackerearth.com**._

We always aim to provide the best user experience to recruiters. Therefore, HackerEarth Live Interview now supports the feature of recording the audio and video of interviews. 

The advantages of this feature are as follows:

*   One of the primary benefits of recording an interview (audio or video) is that it allows the interviewer to concentrate on the interview rather than writing notes, which can act as a distraction to both the interviewee and the person(s) asking the questions.
    
*   Recorded interviews allow the candidates and interviewers to develop and foster a better relationship and rapport during the interview that led to the candidate providing more detailed and in-depth information.
    
*   In addition to fostering a more positive, interactive, and informative discussion during the interview, audio and video recording also improve the quality and transparency of the provided information.
    
*   It also offers the advantage of providing feedback about the interviewers' techniques and ensuring more informative and productive interviews in the future.
    

Steps

To record the audio and video of your scheduled interviews, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account by using the admin credentials.
2.  Click **FaceCode**.  
    ![Screenshot_from_2023-01-06_13-48-20.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14265520530585-1.png) 
3.  Now, schedule a new interview or go to the **Ongoing interviews** section. To know more about how to schedule new interviews, click [here](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360006812634-scheduling-a-new-interview).
4.  Click the name of the interview.
5.  As soon as you are redirected to the Interview interface, the **Share your screen** dialog box appears on the screen asking permission to **share your entire screen**, **application window**, or **Chrome tab**.  
    ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-45-43-0931-AM.png)
6.  Select the displayed window in the box and click **Share**.

You have successfully started the recording of the interview. To stop the sharing of your screen, click **Stop sharing** which is available at the bottom of your screen.  
![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-45-44-8331-AM.png)

If you click **Cancel**, then the video screen recording of the interview does not occur. However, the audio of the interview and the members' physical environment are recorded from the webcam.   
![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-45-41-6116-AM.png)

text:
Enable Audio or Video on FaceCode
FaeCode interview
You can enable Audio and Video for your Facecode interview after joining the interview. To enable video, follow these steps:
Join the interview using the interview link.
Click the Video button which is disabled in the bottom left corner.
A pop-up will appear prompting you to share your screen. If you want to share your screen, choose the window you want to share, If you do not want to share your screen, click Cancel. 
Note: This pop-up appears only for the first time. In case you click cancel then you will have to click the icon on the address bar to see the prompt.
Video will be enabled in your FaceCode interview.
You can also enable Audio in the FaceCode interview by following these steps:
Join the interview using the interview link.
Click the Audio button which is disabled in the bottom left corner.
A pop-up will show stating that Audio is enabled.
This is how you can enable Audio or Video in the FaceCode interview.
Browser settings
The Camera Permissions dialog box will not be displayed when the status of the camera is disabled. Follow these steps to enable camera permissions:
Google Chrome
On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open the permission dialog.
Select Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your camera.
Click Done. 
For more details, read this.
To enable microphone permissions, follow these steps:
On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open the permission dialog.
Select Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your microphone. 
3, Click Done.
For more details, read this.
Mozilla Firefox
On the Address bar, click . 
Click to enable camera permissions.
Note: The ‘You may need to reload the page for changes to apply’ message will be displayed on the screen. 
Click . 
Click Allow in the dialog box that is displayed on the screen.
For more details, read this.
Safari
Click Safari.
Click Preference to open the Preference window. 
On the Toolbar, click Websites. 
In the General section, click Camera. 
In the Currently Open Websites window, select Allow beside hackerearth.com. 
Close the window and refresh the page.
For more details, read this.
If this does not fix your webcam issue, try this.
markdown:
# Enable Audio or Video on FaceCode

## FaeCode interview

You can enable Audio and Video for your Facecode interview after joining the interview. To enable video, follow these steps:

1.  Join the interview using the interview link.
2.  Click the Video button which is disabled in the bottom left corner.

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-0-Jan-30-2023-11-38-02-4397-AM.png)

3.  A pop-up will appear prompting you to share your screen. If you want to share your screen, choose the window you want to share, If you do not want to share your screen, click Cancel.

**Note:** This pop-up appears only for the first time. In case you click cancel then you will have to click the icon on the address bar to see the prompt.

4.  Video will be enabled in your FaceCode interview.

You can also enable Audio in the FaceCode interview by following these steps:

1.  Join the interview using the interview link.
2.  Click the Audio button which is disabled in the bottom left corner.

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-1-Jan-30-2023-11-37-56-7989-AM.png)

3.  A pop-up will show stating that Audio is enabled.

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-2-Jan-30-2023-11-38-03-9709-AM.png)

This is how you can enable Audio or Video in the FaceCode interview.

## Browser settings

The Camera Permissions dialog box will not be displayed when the status of the camera is disabled. Follow these steps to enable camera permissions:

### Google Chrome

1.  On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open the permission dialog.
2.  Select **Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your camera**.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-3-Jan-30-2023-11-38-06-6082-AM.png)
3.  Click **Done**.

For more details, read [this](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/2693767?hl=en).

To enable microphone permissions, follow these steps:

1.  On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open the permission dialog.
2.  Select **Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your microphone**.

![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-4-Jan-30-2023-11-38-09-1277-AM.png)

3, Click **Done**.

For more details, read [this](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/2693767?hl=en).

### Mozilla Firefox

1.  On the Address bar, click ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-5-Jan-30-2023-11-38-00-7683-AM.png).![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-6-Jan-30-2023-11-37-55-1602-AM.png)
2.  Click ![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-7-Jan-30-2023-11-38-07-7941-AM.png) to enable camera permissions.**Note**: The ‘**You may need to reload the page for changes to apply**’ message will be displayed on the screen.
3.  Click ![mceclip5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-8-Jan-30-2023-11-38-05-1319-AM.png).
4.  Click **Allow** in the dialog box that is displayed on the screen.  
    ![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-9-Jan-30-2023-11-37-59-5211-AM.png)

For more details, read [this](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1070636).

### Safari

1.  Click Safari.
2.  Click **Preference** to open the **Preference** window.
3.  On the Toolbar, click **Websites**.
4.  In the **General** section, click **Camera**.
5.  In the **Currently Open Websites** window, select **Allow** beside hackerearth.com.
6.  Close the window and refresh the page.  
    ![mceclip10.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image-10-Jan-30-2023-11-37-58-2283-AM.png)

For more details, read [this](https://support.apple.com/en-in/guide/safari/welcome).

If this does not fix your webcam issue, try [this](https://support.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003031934).

text:
Evaluation templates
Evaluation templates in FaceCode help you to create your own evaluation template where you can add your own evaluation criteria with each template. This will allow you to copy these templates easily to any interview.
To create your own evaluation template, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth account.
Click FaceCode in the Admin dashboard.
Click on the right side.
Click FaceCode settings.
Under the FaceCode settings sections, click Evaluation templates.
You can search for your existing templates or create new templates.
To create a new evaluation template, click Add new evaluation template.
Enter the name of the new template and start adding the evaluation criteria. To add the evaluation criteria, click Add criteria.
Click Save changes. Your evaluation template has been created.
markdown:
# Evaluation templates

Evaluation templates in FaceCode help you to create your own evaluation template where you can add your own evaluation criteria with each template. This will allow you to copy these templates easily to any interview.

To create your own evaluation template, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth account.
    
2.  Click FaceCode in the Admin dashboard.
    

![1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12590751637657-1.png?width=448&height=89&name=12590751637657-1.png)

3.  Click ![2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12590782842009-1.png)  on the right side.
    
4.  Click FaceCode settings.
    

![3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12590751331865-1.png?width=451&height=191&name=12590751331865-1.png)

5.  Under the FaceCode settings sections, click **Evaluation templates**.
    

![4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12590782519321-1.png?width=458&height=143&name=12590782519321-1.png)

6.  You can search for your existing templates or create new templates.
    
7.  To create a new evaluation template, click **Add new evaluation template**.
    

![5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12590782221977-1.png?width=485&height=79&name=12590782221977-1.png)

8.  Enter the name of the new template and start adding the evaluation criteria. To add the evaluation criteria, click **Add criteria**.
    
9.  Click **Save changes**. Your evaluation template has been created.
    

![6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12590782222617-1.png?width=495&height=70&name=12590782222617-1.png)

text:
Screen share in FaceCode
You can also request screen share in the FaceCode interview to evaluate the candidate in real-time while taking their interview. Screen share is very useful when you have to assess the abilities of the candidate while he or she is attempting a coding question. You can simply Request screen share by following these steps:
1. In the FaceCode interview, click Request screen share to request the candidate to share their screen.
2. A request will be sent to the candidate to share their screen. You will see a processing bar beside the option now.

3. The candidate will get a prompt when you send a request to share their screen.
4. When they select Share my screen, they will get another prompt to select what they want to share. They can share the entire screen, a particular window, or a particular tab.
Once they select the screen that needs to be shared, you can see their screen.
markdown:
# Screen share in FaceCode

You can also request screen share in the FaceCode interview to evaluate the candidate in real-time while taking their interview. Screen share is very useful when you have to assess the abilities of the candidate while he or she is attempting a coding question. You can simply **Request screen share** by following these steps**:**

1\. In the FaceCode interview, click **Request screen share** to request the candidate to share their screen.

![1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/1-Jan-30-2023-11-38-41-4302-AM.png?width=488&height=476&name=1-Jan-30-2023-11-38-41-4302-AM.png)

2\. A request will be sent to the candidate to share their screen. You will see a processing bar beside the option now.

  
![2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/2-Jan-30-2023-11-38-45-7547-AM.png?width=463&height=464&name=2-Jan-30-2023-11-38-45-7547-AM.png)

3\. The candidate will get a prompt when you send a request to share their screen.

![3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/3-Jan-30-2023-11-38-42-7378-AM.png?width=499&height=340&name=3-Jan-30-2023-11-38-42-7378-AM.png)

4\. When they select **Share my screen**, they will get another prompt to select what they want to share. They can share the entire screen, a particular window, or a particular tab.

![4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/4-Jan-30-2023-11-38-44-1242-AM.png?width=487&height=445&name=4-Jan-30-2023-11-38-44-1242-AM.png)

Once they select the screen that needs to be shared, you can see their screen.

text:
Adding interviewers
To invite more interviewers to participate in your interview, follow these steps:
Click Add interviewers.
Enter the Full name and Email of the interviewer.
You have successfully added an interviewer. You can add up to 4 interviewers including yourself.
Note: Once you add a person to the interview as an interviewer, they become the admin of the interview. They will receive their login credentials in their email.
markdown:
# Adding interviewers

To invite more interviewers to participate in your interview, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Add interviewers**.
    
    ![Interviewer.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Interviewer-1.png)
    
2.  Enter the Full name and Email of the interviewer.

![Addinterviewers.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Addinterviewers-1.png)

You have successfully added an interviewer. You can add up to 4 interviewers including yourself.

_Note_: Once you add a person to the interview as an interviewer, they become the admin of the interview. They will receive their login credentials in their email.

text:
Adding an interviewer to an ongoing interview
To add an interviewer to an ongoing test, follow these steps:
Log in to HackerEarth Recruit using admin credentials. 
Important: It is assumed that you have scheduled an interview with the candidate and the interview has already started. For more information, see Creating a new interview.
Go back to the FaceCode dashboard page.
In the All interviews section, click Ongoing. 
Select the name of the interview to which you want to add an interviewer. For example, Java developer.
Click Edit.
Click Add interviewers.
Enter the name and email ID of the interviewer who you want to add to your interview.
Click Save.

The following confirmation message will be displayed. 
You have successfully added interviewers to your interview.
markdown:
# Adding an interviewer to an ongoing interview

To add an interviewer to an ongoing test, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to HackerEarth Recruit using admin credentials.
    
    _Important_: It is assumed that you have scheduled an interview with the candidate and the interview has already started. For more information, see [Creating a new interview](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://support.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360006812634-Creating-a-new-interview&sa=D&source=hangouts&ust=1532172540993000&usg=AFQjCNF53b6KHh6TVukorYwnOqTe8tnCKg).
    
2.  Go back to the FaceCode dashboard page.
3.  In the **All interviews** section, click **Ongoing**. 
    
    ![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-35-37-8696-AM.png)
    
4.  Select the name of the interview to which you want to add an interviewer. For example, _Java developer._
5.  Click **Edit**.  
    
6.  Click **Add interviewers**.
    
    ![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-35-39-2346-AM.png)
    
7.  Enter the name and email ID of the interviewer who you want to add to your interview.
8.  Click **Save**.  
    The following confirmation message will be displayed. 

       ![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-35-36-5271-AM.png)

You have successfully added interviewers to your interview.

text:
Diagram board
HackerEarth provides you with a Diagram board in the interview. This can be used to ask diagram questions, text questions, flowchart based questions, and other diagram related questions. 
There are different diagram related questions you can ask the candidate. You can use the following tools:
General
Azure
AWS
UML
Flowchart
In general, you can also add a text-based question by selecting Text option.
You can create various diagram-based questions to assess the candidate's concepts of Flowchart, UML diagrams, and other development cycle related questions. You can also insert link or image URL to the diagram board.
A candidate can draw diagrams when asked to design architecture or a similar question. On the left side, you have the different components that you or a candidate can drag and drop into the diagram board. 
A diagram board can be effectively used by you to assess the flow approach and presence of mind of a candidate during the interview.
markdown:
# Diagram board

HackerEarth provides you with a Diagram board in the interview. This can be used to ask diagram questions, text questions, flowchart based questions, and other diagram related questions. 

![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_12-08-54.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14493287451417.png)

There are different diagram related questions you can ask the candidate. You can use the following tools:

1.  General
2.  Azure
3.  AWS
4.  UML
5.  Flowchart

In general, you can also add a text-based question by selecting **Text** option.

You can create various diagram-based questions to assess the candidate's concepts of Flowchart, UML diagrams, and other development cycle related questions. You can also insert link or image URL to the diagram board.

A candidate can draw diagrams when asked to design architecture or a similar question. On the left side, you have the different components that you or a candidate can drag and drop into the diagram board. 

A diagram board can be effectively used by you to assess the flow approach and presence of mind of a candidate during the interview.

text:
HackerEarth Live Interview: Transcripts
This is a premium feature. To enable this feature for your account, contact us at support@hackerearth.com.
We always aim to provide the best user experience to recruiters. Therefore, HackerEarth Live Interview now supports the feature of generating, displaying, and storing transcripts.
HackerEarth performs speech-to-text conversion for recognizing and translating spoken words into written texts. The written texts are known as transcripts. These transcripts are available on the platform for an infinite period of time.
This is especially helpful when it is tough to understand a speaker's pitch, accents, or dialects. It helps participants understand each other in a better manner as it reinforces what was said by the other person. This feature also helps hearing-impaired participants. Thus, aligning the interview process with Inclusion hiring. 
You can also turn on the Highlights feature that highlights important information in the transcript thus allowing you to focus on key parts of the conversation such as the questions that were asked and their corresponding answers.
To view the transcripts of your scheduled interviews, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth account by using the admin credentials.
Click FaceCode.
In the All interview section, click Completed.
Click View transcripts to view the transcripts of specific interviews.

The interview transcript is displayed as follows:
To view the highlights of your interview transcript, click beside Show highlights.
markdown:
# HackerEarth Live Interview: Transcripts

_This is a premium feature. To enable this feature for your account, contact us at **support@hackerearth.com**._

We always aim to provide the best user experience to recruiters. Therefore, HackerEarth Live Interview now supports the feature of generating, displaying, and storing transcripts.

HackerEarth performs speech-to-text conversion for recognizing and translating spoken words into written texts. The written texts are known as transcripts. These transcripts are available on the platform for an infinite period of time.

This is especially helpful when it is tough to understand a speaker's pitch, accents, or dialects. It helps participants understand each other in a better manner as it reinforces what was said by the other person. This feature also helps hearing-impaired participants. Thus, aligning the interview process with Inclusion hiring. 

You can also turn on the **Highlights** feature that highlights important information in the transcript thus allowing you to focus on key parts of the conversation such as the questions that were asked and their corresponding answers.

To view the transcripts of your scheduled interviews, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth account by using the admin credentials.
2.  Click **FaceCode**.  
    ![Screenshot_from_2023-01-06_13-48-20.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14265744739225-1.png) 
3.  In the **All interview** section, click **Completed**.
4.  Click **View transcripts** to view the transcripts of specific interviews.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-47-08-0394-AM.png)  
    

The interview transcript is displayed as follows:  

![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-47-09-4189-AM.png)

To view the highlights of your interview transcript, click ![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-47-05-2533-AM.png) beside **Show highlights**.

text:
Locking and unlocking questions in a FaceCode interview
You can lock the code editor for the questions in your FaceCode interview. This will help you with better proctoring over your interviews. 
FaceCode has introduced the feature of locking the code editor for a programming question in FaceCode. This will allow you to prevent the candidates from making any changes to the solution that the candidate has written for the questions. You can also unlock these questions whenever you want. This feature will help you control the amount of time you want to give to a particular candidate to solve the question in a FaceCode interview. This will also provide better proctoring over your interviews, as candidates cannot edit a locked question after looking for a better answer online. Each interviewer can lock their questions separately if there are multiple interview rounds. 
How to lock/unlock a question in Facecode?
To lock a particular question in the FaeCode interview, follow these steps:
Join the FaceCode interview as an interviewer. 
Click the Lock icon to lock the code editor for the candidate. 
You will be shown a dialog box stating if you are sure about locking the code editor. Click Lock the editor. This will lock the code editor so that candidates cannot make any changes to their solution.
The lock will turn red, and you will be shown the message as shown in the given image.
To unlock the question, click the red lock again. The message will no longer be shown, and the lock icon’s color will be changed.
This is how you can easily lock/unlock the question in a FaceCode interview.
You will also be able to see the questions that you have locked in the interview in our FaceCode report for the interview.
markdown:
# Locking and unlocking questions in a FaceCode interview

## You can lock the code editor for the questions in your FaceCode interview. This will help you with better proctoring over your interviews.

FaceCode has introduced the feature of locking the code editor for a programming question in FaceCode. This will allow you to prevent the candidates from making any changes to the solution that the candidate has written for the questions. You can also unlock these questions whenever you want. This feature will help you control the amount of time you want to give to a particular candidate to solve the question in a FaceCode interview. This will also provide better proctoring over your interviews, as candidates cannot edit a locked question after looking for a better answer online. Each interviewer can lock their questions separately if there are multiple interview rounds.    

### **How to lock/unlock a question in Facecode?**

To lock a particular question in the FaeCode interview, follow these steps:

1.  Join the FaceCode interview as an interviewer. 
2.  Click the **Lock icon** to lock the code editor for the candidate.   
    ![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/lbVUxLAeb0NzCvURAOUB7p5OCnTBSJfdMk0JFdbu42WnQ2Qiz1l4irxoQkN_ijSOF35_z_cEz-3WeCdHwfXvuyUWMkKx0Kjy4EqkC2jM82PjycDrOTkh4Ze7fqXKUzbWiR19WEkn73zxIq2NbgBSd6U)
3.  You will be shown a dialog box stating if you are sure about locking the code editor. Click **Lock the editor.** This will lock the code editor so that candidates cannot make any changes to their solution.  
    ![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/KExX319a8WT5WWTOWk5Ds_acA-q2un3SdPNyopygKLKkzL4bhhotE2SeJifgS1KG0MNnOt5dHToI11juHDygl45s5YnNJ8neIKpcGO6YMu3q6RExUaogiDepcgC0-PWOdvBMKWe_6YLsaX6aqPCYybM)
4.  The lock will turn red, and you will be shown the message as shown in the given image.  
    ![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/PRMlo9COQ0LnS53bx4aHLJjDDBpvJbotOdhSmIGkRsMdoDWnlci10XdzeyNX7ri9WaV4oyp8Hs8IFs7LP24-_qiaVfViA_NVEEEN_UO1iS9D4dc_vABD8hdo941Yqwb5vieIatohHb93zm_nhM0xlfU)
5.  To unlock the question, click the red lock again. The message will no longer be shown, and the lock icon’s color will be changed.  
    ![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/9iodhQeV73IOIAfwowiZNy-_w_yG8zFsB0vecb25z_50k-DtnCiRJ_qET3lHTlBXJZ37pprySmaex569GuyazCGdToVOkcHeKrdO2b481C6j3WDrKq4tSiucOqCc2swd5POcX8UC-snd3mZJdrc1xB0)

This is how you can easily lock/unlock the question in a FaceCode interview.

You will also be able to see the questions that you have locked in the interview in our FaceCode report for the interview.

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/1Iy0FiVG8rsBJ4Eed7TYmdWeAVZhPrn6AHAA-kUnPAMsFBoyzyL4mgZ3Pou5K635v4PHMM0a2XNHv2uvWx9AcYIdD5fWDaG0fOBQOd4GuKwOfoAGDT-kT_ICMSA7NRzGcu5Yv51zj5EEN4_8WhBCNAY)

text:
Single interview link
What is single interview link?
We have now removed multiple links for the FaceCode interview and replaced them with a single interview link that can be accessed by both the candidate and the interviewers. We have removed the direct interview link and replaced it with sign in flow to increase the security on the platform.
When you will click on the single interview link, you will be redirected to the Login screen only if you are not logged in already.
Only the candidate and interviewers defined for the interview can access the link and join the interview.
How to join as an interviewer
Existing interviewer
If you have already been an interviewer on FaceCode and are being prompted to sign in and do not have a password, click Forgot password to set a new password. You will be asked for your email id and you will receive an email containing the credentials required to log in. 
This is a one-time thing as from the next time, you will directly join the interview.
First-time interviewer
If you are taking an interview for the first time on FaceCode, the interview invite received over email will have your credentials which are required to sign in to FaceCode.
markdown:
# Single interview link

**What is single interview link?**

We have now removed multiple links for the FaceCode interview and replaced them with a single interview link that can be accessed by both the candidate and the interviewers. We have removed the direct interview link and replaced it with sign in flow to increase the security on the platform.

![SML1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/SML1-1.png)

When you will click on the single interview link, you will be redirected to the Login screen only if you are not logged in already.

Only the candidate and interviewers defined for the interview can access the link and join the interview.

![SML2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/SML2-1.png)

How to join as an interviewer

**Existing interviewer**

If you have already been an interviewer on FaceCode and are being prompted to sign in and do not have a password, click **Forgot password** to set a new password. You will be asked for your email id and you will receive an email containing the credentials required to log in. 

This is a one-time thing as from the next time, you will directly join the interview.

**First-time interviewer**

If you are taking an interview for the first time on FaceCode, the interview invite received over email will have your credentials which are required to sign in to FaceCode.

![SML3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/SML3-1.png)

# FaceCode interview report

## This article tells you about the major components of a FaceCode interview report.

The FaceCode interview report is generated after a candidate has completed the interview. This report is generated for recruiters to share with candidates. 

You can view the following information in this report:

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/y_LwTW571lYnmjvUIgd0BX95GC9-pMXJjBmeJhi1D1KiB_L0r1aopFddWBlDiA9Ku6KBxDlaiy0mo_JwdHHlLpU7F7xI5snhQJlbWmtZ-XGLcg-W0xCpcF6-I5pjhQjwRVsrBqwf3LpobjbQs1HQMDk)

  

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| **S. no.** | **Function** |
| 1   | Represents the name of the candidate |
| 2   | Represents all the information of the FaceCode interview |
| 3   | Represents the list of the interviewers that you can switch between in the report |
| 4   | Represents the currently selected interviewer’s name |
| 5   | Represents the interview summary |
| 6   | Represents the complete interview summary based on the score, transcripts, code quality, etc. |
| 7   | Represents the status of the candidate according to the current interviewer |
| 8   | Represents the number of interviewers who Accepted, Rejected, or stayed Neutral about the candidate |
| 9   | Represents a button that allows you to copy the interview summary |

### Insights

Insights help you see the interview details, such as conversation time, time spent on coding, etc.

You can see the following insights in a FaceCode report:

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/jsVn0huEMA8s8PNzVkrDzWCV4gBw2jpGf8Be0LCpQe4r3qg8uo_a4icJbNvPTHovteCtTrrCdq6pylN0YQ8zfQW_4PPitMKHjRrC0dYe7f2NzDVjfCAiAhRY-HZgGi3AjySFnZTjiWErjw3caGNx4ZI)  

  

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| **S. no.** | **Insight** |
| 1   | Represents the total conversation time between the interviewer and the candidate |
| 2   | Represents the ratio between the time the video was on for the candidate out of the total time of the interview |
| 3   | Represents the total number of times the candidate has navigated away from the interview |
| 4   | Represents the ratio between the time spent by the candidate talking and the time spent by the candidate in listening to the interviewer |
| 5   | Represents the total time spent by the candidate on writing the code |

#### ![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/xq7vUQ_xKr745DVGwsPuoR-I4cWx8amkexoy5aOe5xOcJox3_dw0HE2oTrWD9MN_NxIahFnnhDE9XMhVFs7tTBUlymz37nvOVl8yBg-U4-znRQJgfdJLoEu3rD8pvKuHB1OXLYXWAxDam6ytJcLZ22o)

  

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| **S. no.** | **Function** |
| 1   | Represents the tab to see the Interview notes |
| 2   | Represents the tab to see the audio-video recording of the interview |
| 3   | Represents the audio-video recording of the interview |
| 4   | Represents the button to listen to the audio-video recording of the interview |
| 5   | Represents the button to download the recording |
| 6   | Represents the button to copy the link to the recording |

![](https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/UBmaGkB9NgrQrQaImsKkPsagCh_y12TF0l6fhpSVu1B2_yuKhgkfqNk_QF4e-V6sGIA6xGXhxMgiCjl-oKGywCcr10g-SwIZk6E4sPfTz6fcG15u_SQhpzWDpgKBsbOEcK6StEHSzxEndNvDPtjIbUI)

There are different criteria based on which you can score a candidate in an interview. The one you select will be shown in the FaeCode report. You can also create your own criteria. The ones shown in the given image are as follows:

1.  Communication skills
2.  Ability to debug the code
3.  Quality of code
4.  Solution and execution

You can easily see the score which the interviewer has given.

These are the main components of a FaceCode report after the interview.

text:
Background option - Video blur
In this article, we will discuss how to use the video blur option in FaceCode.
We have added video blur to the background options for FaceCode interviews. Now, you can easily blur the background of your video while interviewing a candidate. 
You have three blur intensities that can be applied, which are as follows:
None: Applies no effect to the background of the video
Partial: Applies partial blur effect to the background of the video
Full: Applies complete blur effect to the background of the video
To apply the blur effect in the background, follow these steps:
1. Log in to the FaceCode interview with your admin credentials.
2. Click More in the menu bar.
3. Select Background options.
4. Enable your web camera by clicking enable video if it is not already enabled. If enabled, select the blur option you want to apply to your video background.
You have successfully applied the background blur option in the background of your video.
markdown:
# Background option - Video blur

## In this article, we will discuss how to use the video blur option in FaceCode.

We have added video blur to the background options for FaceCode interviews. Now, you can easily blur the background of your video while interviewing a candidate. 

You have three blur intensities that can be applied, which are as follows:

1.  None: Applies no effect to the background of the video
2.  Partial: Applies partial blur effect to the background of the video
3.  Full: Applies complete blur effect to the background of the video

To apply the blur effect in the background, follow these steps:

1\. Log in to the FaceCode interview with your admin credentials.

2\. Click **More** in the menu bar**.**

**![Screenshot from 2024-04-10 15-32-14](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202024-04-10%2015-32-14.png?width=430&height=404&name=Screenshot%20from%202024-04-10%2015-32-14.png)**

3\. Select **Background options.**

**![Screenshot from 2024-04-10 15-34-16](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202024-04-10%2015-34-16.png?width=501&height=83&name=Screenshot%20from%202024-04-10%2015-34-16.png)**

4\. Enable your web camera by clicking **enable video** if it is not already enabled. If enabled, select the blur option you want to apply to your video background.

![Screenshot from 2024-04-10 15-39-57](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202024-04-10%2015-39-57.png?width=358&height=150&name=Screenshot%20from%202024-04-10%2015-39-57.png)

You have successfully applied the background blur option in the background of your video.

markdown:
# Where is the candidate?

## Where is the candidate allows you to follow the candidate’s activities while they are in the interview. This feature allows you to automatically switch tabs and languages based on the candidate's actions.

**Where is the candidate** is a feature that allows you to follow the candidate's activities while they are in a FaceCode interview. It allows you to see where the candidate is, which means on which tab during the interview, and also removes the hassle of switching tabs again and again as it automatically switches the tabs and languages based on the candidate's actions. You need to click the **Follow candidate** button to follow the candidate's activity. 

### **How does 'Where is the candidate' work?**

This feature provides you with real-time updates on the candidate's actions within the FaceCode interview. It not only shows you where the candidate is located within the interface but also alerts you if they attempt to navigate away from the interview. This enables you to closely monitor the candidate's engagement and ensure they stay focused throughout the assessment process.

You can see the initials of the candidate on a particular tab as given in the image which signifies where the candidate is currently working in the interview interface. 

![Follow](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Follow.png?width=688&height=340&name=Follow.png)

                                                               **Where is the candidate**

This allows you to see and monitor a candidate's activities during the interview. 

### Follow candidate

You can track the candidate's real-time movements during the FaceCode interview by clicking the **Follow candidate** button. This feature allows you to see where the candidate is located within the interface and automatically adjust tabs and languages based on the candidate's actions. This functionality streamlines the assessment process for interviewers, allowing them to stay updated on the candidate's progress without the need for manual tab switching.

![Follow candidate](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Follow%20candidate.png?width=688&height=340&name=Follow%20candidate.png)

                                                              **Follow candidate button**

To learn more about how the **Follow candidate** button works, watch [this video](https://www.loom.com/share/afbd9616d5714e8cacb04247e6ebc457?sid=531652fb-c58b-4940-a0fe-726fa405a534).

text:
Scheduling a new interview
To create a new interview, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.
Click FaceCode.
You will have two options visible to you 
Schedule interview later
Get interview link
1) Schedule interview later
Click Schedule interview later.
You can select Single interview or Multiple interviews. Single interview will create a single interview invite but if you want to send multiple links to multiple candidates, you can select Multiple interviews.
On the Schedule interview page, enter the following details:
Interview information
Title: Enter the name of the interview. For example, ML Engineer interview. 
This information will set the expectations for other interviewers and help them understand what type of questions to ask during the interview.
Date and time
Date: Date on which the interview is scheduled
Start time: Time at which the interview is scheduled to start
Time zone: Time zone where you reside. The interview time in the emails sent to the interviewers and the candidate will be from this time zone.
Interviewers
Here you can view the names and email IDs of the interviewers who you have invited for the interview.
Adding interviewers
You can invite more interviewers to participate in your interview. You can add up to 4 interviewers including yourself.
For more information about adding more interviewers, click here.
Candidate information
Name: Full name of the candidate
Email: Email ID of the candidate
Country code: International dialing code of the country in which the candidate resides
Phone number: Candidate's contact number (mobile or local numbers)
Interview evaluation
You can choose the type of evaluation for the interview. The two options are the following:
Automatic evaluation
Custom evaluation
Click Schedule interview.
You have successfully scheduled your interview.
Interview details to the candidate
After the interview is scheduled, the candidate receives an email that contains the following interview details:
Company name: The name of the company that has scheduled the interview.
Date: The date and time when the interview is scheduled.
Add to calendar: Now, the candidate can add the interview to his or her Outlook Calendar, Google Calendar, and iCalendar. To know more about how the candidate can synchronize the interview to the calendars, click here.
Interview link: Click this link to join the interview. The candidate does not have to sign in into HackerEarth to join the interview. The candidate is provided with automatically-generated credentials that allow him or her to log in to HackerEarth FaceCode and Assessments.
2) Create interview link
1. Click Create interview link.
2. You will get an interview link ready which can be directly sent to the interviewers and candidate. The interviewers should have an active HackerEarth account. You can easily customize all the details of the interview by clicking Customize interview.
markdown:
# Scheduling a new interview

To create a new interview, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **FaceCode**.  
    ![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_10-54-22.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14490464298137.png)
3.  You will have two options visible to you
    1.  Schedule interview later
    2.  Get interview link

![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_10-55-23.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14490497365529.png)

### 1) Schedule interview later

1.  Click **Schedule interview later**.  
    ![Schedulelater.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Schedulelater-1.png)
2.  You can select **Single interview** or **Multiple interviews**. Single interview will create a single interview invite but if you want to send multiple links to multiple candidates, you can select Multiple interviews.
3.  On the **Schedule interview** page, enter the following details:

### Interview information

*   **Title**: Enter the name of the interview. For example, ML Engineer interview.  
    This information will set the expectations for other interviewers and help them understand what type of questions to ask during the interview.

### Date and time

*   **Date**: Date on which the interview is scheduled
*   **Start time**: Time at which the interview is scheduled to start
*   **Time zone**: Time zone where you reside. The interview time in the emails sent to the interviewers and the candidate will be from this time zone.

### Interviewers

Here you can view the names and email IDs of the interviewers who you have invited for the interview.

#### _Adding interviewers_

You can invite more interviewers to participate in your interview. You can add up to **4** interviewers including yourself.  
For more information about adding more interviewers, click [here](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007014613-adding-interviewers).

### Candidate information

*   **Name**: Full name of the candidate
*   **Email**: Email ID of the candidate
*   **Country code**: International dialing code of the country in which the candidate resides
*   **Phone number**: Candidate's contact number (mobile or local numbers)

### **Interview evaluation**

You can choose the type of evaluation for the interview. The two options are the following:

1.  Automatic evaluation
2.  Custom evaluation

Click **Schedule interview.**

You have successfully scheduled your interview.

![ScheduledInterview.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/ScheduledInterview-1.png)

### Interview details to the candidate

After the interview is scheduled, the candidate receives an email that contains the following interview details:

1.  **Company name**: The name of the company that has scheduled the interview.
2.  **Date**: The date and time when the interview is scheduled.
3.  **Add to calendar**: Now, the candidate can add the interview to his or her Outlook Calendar, Google Calendar, and iCalendar. To know more about how the candidate can synchronize the interview to the calendars, click [here](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900002530826-adding-an-interview-to-your-calendar).
4.  **Interview link**: Click this link to join the interview. The candidate does not have to sign in into HackerEarth to join the interview. The candidate is provided with automatically-generated credentials that allow him or her to log in to HackerEarth FaceCode and Assessments.

### 2) Create interview link

1\. Click **Create interview link.**

![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_11-01-54.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14490748117017.png)

2\. You will get an interview link ready which can be directly sent to the interviewers and candidate. The interviewers should have an active HackerEarth account. You can easily customize all the details of the interview by clicking Customize interview.

![GetLink.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/GetLink-1.png)

text:
Adding questions to your interview
To add questions to your interview, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Recruit account using your admin credentials.
Click FaceCode.
In the All interviews section, click Ongoing.
Click the name of the interview to which you want to add questions. You will be directed to the interview page. For example, ML Engineer Interview. You will be redirected to the interview.
Click to Add questions.
You can add questions in the following ways:
Add a question
Choose from library
Import questions from test
Add a question
To create and add questions manually in your interview, follow these steps:
Click Add a question.
Enter the name of the problem and the problem statement.
Upload sample input and sample output.
Click Save.
You have successfully created and added a new question to your interview.
Choose from library
To add questions from My Library, follow these steps:
Click Choose from library.
You can select if you want to add questions from HackerEarth's library or My library.
Select the question type and difficulty level.
Select the questions that you want to add to your interview.
Important: You can add only five questions at a time.
Click Add selected. 
You have successfully added questions from library.
Import questions from test
To import questions from the test, follow these steps:
Click Import questions from test. 
Select the questions you want to add from the test to the interview. 
Click Add selected. 
You have successfully added questions to your interview. The questions will be visible to the candidate.
markdown:
# Adding questions to your interview

To add questions to your interview, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Recruit account using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **FaceCode**.
3.  In the **All interviews** section, click **Ongoing**.
4.  Click the name of the interview to which you want to add questions. You will be directed to the interview page. For example, **ML Engineer Interview**. You will be redirected to the interview.
    
    ![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-25-25-1303-AM.png)
    
5.  Click ![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_11-39-37.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14492143185305.png?width=23&height=29&name=14492143185305.png) to **Add questions**.

![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_11-40-28.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14492190249497.png?width=556&height=279&name=14492190249497.png)

You can add questions in the following ways:

1.  Add a question
2.  Choose from library
3.  Import questions from test

![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_11-42-58.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14492232666521.png)

### **Add a question**

To create and add questions manually in your interview, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Add a question**.
2.  Enter the name of the problem and the problem statement.
3.  Upload **sample input** and **sample output**.
4.  Click **Save**.

You have successfully created and added a new question to your interview.

### **Choose from library**

To add questions from My Library, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Choose from library**.
2.  You can select if you want to add questions from HackerEarth's library or My library.
3.  Select the question type and difficulty level.
4.  Select the questions that you want to add to your interview.
    
    _Important_: You can add only five questions at a time.
    
5.  Click **Add selected.**

You have successfully added questions from library.

### **Import questions from test**

To import questions from the test, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Import questions from test.**
2.  Select the questions you want to add from the test to the interview**.**
3.  Click **Add selected.**

You have successfully added questions to your interview. The questions will be visible to the candidate.

markdown:
# Default evaluation criteria

There are various parameters based on which the evaluation of the candidate can be done. Each parameter is scored on a scale of 5. 

The parameters are as follows:

1\. **Communication skills** (ability to understand the question and explain solution)

1.  *   Poor
    *   Could not explain the solution properly 
    *   Good
    *   Explained the solution properly 
    *   Excellent

2\. **Ability to debug the code**

1.  *   Could not debug code
    *   Could only debug a few errors
    *   Could debug only the standard errors 
    *   Could debug most of the errors 
    *   Wrote a perfect code  
        

3\. **Quality of code**

1.  *   Poor
    *   Unformatted code
    *   Basic concepts are covered 
    *   Reusable and readable
    *   Perfect code

4\. **Solution and Execution** 

*   Unoptimized code and could not solve the question properly
*   Partly-optimized code and partially solved the question
*   Basically-optimized code and solved the question covering the basic concepts
*   Well-optimized code and solved the whole question 
*   Perfectly-optimized code and the solution prints the required output

The scores can be added in real-time but they are available later on as well where the automated summary is presented.
