text:
Personally identifiable information (PII)
This is a premium feature. To enable this feature for your account, contact us at support@hackerearth.com.
HackerEarth has always strived to provide fair and unbiased assessments. Therefore, to enhance the candidate experience and ensure fairness in tests or interviews, HackerEarth Assessment and live interviews now support the feature of hiding personally identifiable information of candidates from recruiters. We believe that any personal information of candidates is not a mandatory aspect to get selected for a job role.
PII
Personally identifiable information (PII) is any data that can be used to identify a specific individual. The common details that are considered as PII are name, social security numbers, mailing or email addresses, and phone numbers but technology has expanded the scope of PII considerably. Now, it can include IP addresses, login IDs, social media posts, digital images, geographical locations, biometric identifiers, and behavioral data.
Diversity and Inclusion
This feature is introduced to help you promote Diversity and Inclusion in your organization by using HackerEarth Assessment. Diversity and Inclusion allow you to implement strategies and practices to support a diverse workplace. These implementations can increase the productivity of your employees and increase the profit of your organization to succeed in the global marketplace.
Diversity
This feature allows you to practice workplace diversity where you can understand, accept, and value difference between people based on the following criteria:
Different races, ethnicities, genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations
Differences in education, personalities, skill sets, experiences, and knowledge bases
Inclusion
This feature allows you to create a collaborative, supportive, and respectful environment that increases the participation and contribution of all employees.
Hiding PII
To hide personally identifiable information of candidates, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account by using your admin credentials.
Click .
In the Company section, click Diversity and Inclusion.
If you want to hide the candidate's PII from tests, then click the checkbox beside Hide personal identifiable information (PII) from tests.
Or
If you want to hide the candidate's PII from live interviews, then click the checkbox beside Hide personal information (PII) from interviews.
You have successfully enabled to hide personally identifiable information of candidates in all your tests and interviews.
After you have enabled the option to hide PII from tests or interviews, you can view the following changes:
S. No.	Product	Section	Change	
1	Tests	Test overview settings	In the Proctoring setting, the option to capture candidates' snapshots gets disabled.	
2	Candidate reports	The name of candidates and their email IDs are hidden. The name of a candidate is replaced with the Candidate ID such as Candidate 1, Candidate 2, and so on.	
3	Candidate feedback	The name of candidates is replaced with the Candidate ID such as Candidate 1, Candidate 2, and so on.	
4	Downloaded candidate reports	The columns that contain any PII of candidates are hidden in the report. These columns can contain details such as the name, email ID, contact details, current location, and so on. 	
5	Plagiarism report	The name of candidates is replaced with the Candidate ID such as Candidate 1, Candidate 2, and so on.	
6	Interviews	Emails	In any emails that are received by recruiters, the personal details of candidates such as the name and email ID of the candidate are not displayed.	
7	Interview interface	The name of the candidate is replaced with an anonymous name (PII alias) in the interview interface and Candidate feedback section. 	
You can view these changes only in the tests or interviews that you have created after enabling the option to hide PII from tests or interviews.
markdown:
# Personally identifiable information (PII)

_This is a premium feature. To enable this feature for your account, contact us at **support@hackerearth.com**._

HackerEarth has always strived to provide fair and unbiased assessments. Therefore, to enhance the candidate experience and ensure fairness in tests or interviews, HackerEarth Assessment and live interviews now support the feature of hiding personally identifiable information of candidates from recruiters. We believe that any personal information of candidates is not a mandatory aspect to get selected for a job role.

### PII

Personally identifiable information (PII) is any data that can be used to identify a specific individual. The common details that are considered as PII are name, social security numbers, mailing or email addresses, and phone numbers but technology has expanded the scope of PII considerably. Now, it can include IP addresses, login IDs, social media posts, digital images, geographical locations, biometric identifiers, and behavioral data.

### Diversity and Inclusion

This feature is introduced to help you promote Diversity and Inclusion in your organization by using HackerEarth Assessment. Diversity and Inclusion allow you to implement strategies and practices to support a diverse workplace. These implementations can increase the productivity of your employees and increase the profit of your organization to succeed in the global marketplace.

#### Diversity

This feature allows you to practice workplace diversity where you can understand, accept, and value difference between people based on the following criteria:

*   Different races, ethnicities, genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations
*   Differences in education, personalities, skill sets, experiences, and knowledge bases

#### Inclusion

This feature allows you to create a collaborative, supportive, and respectful environment that increases the participation and contribution of all employees.

### Hiding PII

To hide personally identifiable information of candidates, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account by using your admin credentials.
2.  Click ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-23-50-6839-AM.png).
3.  In the **Company** section, click **Diversity and Inclusion**.
4.  If you want to hide the candidate's PII from tests, then click the checkbox beside **Hide personal identifiable information (PII) from tests**.  
    Or  
    If you want to hide the candidate's PII from live interviews, then click the checkbox beside **Hide personal information (PII) from interviews**.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-23-49-5204-AM.png)

You have successfully enabled to hide personally identifiable information of candidates in all your tests and interviews.

After you have enabled the option to hide PII from tests or interviews, you can view the following changes:

|     |     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **S. No.** | **Product** | **Section** | **Change** |
| 1   | Tests | Test overview settings | In the **Proctoring** setting, the option to capture candidates' snapshots gets disabled. |
| 2   | Candidate reports | The name of candidates and their email IDs are hidden. The name of a candidate is replaced with the **Candidate ID** such as Candidate 1, Candidate 2, and so on. |
| 3   | Candidate feedback | The name of candidates is replaced with the Candidate ID such as Candidate 1, Candidate 2, and so on. |
| 4   | Downloaded candidate reports | The columns that contain any PII of candidates are hidden in the report. These columns can contain details such as the name, email ID, contact details, current location, and so on. |
| 5   | Plagiarism report | The name of candidates is replaced with the Candidate ID such as Candidate 1, Candidate 2, and so on. |
| 6   | Interviews | Emails | In any emails that are received by recruiters, the personal details of candidates such as the name and email ID of the candidate are not displayed. |
| 7   | Interview interface | The name of the candidate is replaced with an anonymous name (PII alias) in the interview interface and **Candidate feedback** section. |

You can view these changes only in the tests or interviews that you have created after enabling the option to hide PII from tests or interviews.

text:
Scheduling an interview in a test
You can schedule an interview in an Ongoing or Completed test with specific candidates. Now, you can schedule the interview without leaving the test interface. 
To schedule an interview in a test, follow these steps:
Log in to HackerEarth Assessment by using your admin credentials.
Click Tests.
Click Ongoing or Completed to schedule the interview.
Click the name of the test in which you are required to schedule the interview with candidates. For example, 
In the Candidates section, click Test taken or Review pending.
Scroll the Candidate reports table to the right to view the Interview Details section.
Click Get interview link.
Click Create interview now. An interview link will be created.
Click Customize interview. 
In the Interviewers section, you can add a maximum of three interviewers including yourself. You are added as an interviewer because you are scheduling the interview. You do not get the option to add more interviewers if three interviewers are added in the interview.
To add an interviewer, follow these steps: 
Click Add more interviewers. 
Enter the name and email ID of the interview.
In the Candidate details, enter the following details: 
Email address: Candidate's email address
Name: Name of the candidate
Country code: International dialing code of the country in which the candidate resides
Phone number: Candidate's contact number (mobile or local numbers)
Resume: You can upload the candidate's resume
Additional information: You can add additional information of the candidate
Select the Interview evaluation. You can choose the type of evaluation for the interview. The two options are the following: 
Automatic evaluation
Custom evaluation
Click Save changes.
Your interview link is ready to be sent.
markdown:
# Scheduling an interview in a test

You can schedule an interview in an Ongoing or Completed test with specific candidates. Now, you can schedule the interview without leaving the test interface. 

To schedule an interview in a test, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to HackerEarth Assessment by using your admin credentials.
2.  Click **Tests**.
3.  Click **Ongoing** or **Completed** to schedule the interview.
4.  Click the name of the test in which you are required to schedule the interview with candidates. For example, 
5.  In the **Candidates** section, click **Test taken** or **Review pending**.
6.  Scroll the Candidate reports table to the right to view the **Interview Details** section.
7.  Click **Get interview link.**  
    ![Screenshot_from_2023-01-13_11-13-38.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/14491144249113.png)
8.  Click **Create interview now**. An interview link will be created.
9.  Click **Customize interview**.  
10.  In the **Interviewers** section, you can add a maximum of three interviewers including yourself. You are added as an interviewer because you are scheduling the interview. You do not get the option to add more interviewers if three interviewers are added in the interview.  
    To add an interviewer, follow these steps:
    1.  Click **Add more interviewers**. 
    2.  Enter the name and email ID of the interview.  
        ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-37-00-5470-AM.png)
11.  In the **Candidate** details, enter the following details: 
    *   Email address: Candidate's email address
    *   Name: Name of the candidate
    *   Country code: International dialing code of the country in which the candidate resides
    *   Phone number: Candidate's contact number (mobile or local numbers)
    *   Resume: You can upload the candidate's resume
    *   Additional information: You can add additional information of the candidate
12.  Select the Interview evaluation. You can choose the type of evaluation for the interview. The two options are the following:
    1.  Automatic evaluation
    2.  Custom evaluation
13.  Click **Save changes**.

Your interview link is ready to be sent.

text:
Generating credentials for Lever
To generate Lever credentials, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.
Click on the bottom-left side of your screen.
Click Integrations.
In the Lever section, click Connect with Lever. You will be redirected to the home page of Lever.
5. Enter your registered email ID and click Next.
6. Enter your password and click Sign in.
7. Click Accept to allow HackerEarth to access data from your Lever account.
8. You can see that the required credentials are generated on the Integration page of HackerEarth Assessment.
9. Enter the Webhook Token which you can get from the Lever website as mentioned in this step.
10. Select Send Notification at Lever if you want to receive notifications in your Lever account.
11. Select the stage where you want to send the invites. There are various stages from which you can choose according to your preference. This is known as the Trigger stage.
12. Click Submit
You have successfully generated the Lever credentials. You will get a callback URL that needs to be pasted in the webhook configurations on Lever's Integration and API section.
To send a HackerEarth test invitation to your candidate from your Lever account, you will need to set up Lever ATS integration. This can be done by following the given steps:
Navigate to the Lever website and select Integrations and API.
The Signature token in the below image is the Webhook Token. Copy this token and paste it into the Webhook Token box in the HackerEarth Portal.
Click VERIFY CONNECTION after putting the Webhook URL in the Webhook Token box.
Your connection will be verified.
markdown:
# Generating credentials for Lever

To generate Lever credentials, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.
2.  Click ![A1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A1-2.png)  on the bottom-left side of your screen.
3.  Click **Integrations**.
4.  In the **Lever** section, click **Connect with Lever**. You will be redirected to the home page of Lever.

![A2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A2-2.png)

5\. Enter your registered email ID and click **Next**.

6\. Enter your password and click **Sign in**.

7\. Click **Accept** to allow HackerEarth to access data from your Lever account.  

![A3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A3-2.png)

8\. You can see that the required credentials are generated on the Integration page of HackerEarth Assessment.

![A4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A4-2.png)

9\. Enter the **Webhook Token** which you can get from the Lever website as mentioned in [this step](#Integration).

10\. Select **Send Notification at Lever** if you want to receive notifications in your Lever account.

11\. Select the stage where you want to send the invites. There are various stages from which you can choose according to your preference. This is known as the **Trigger stage**.

![image__45_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image__45_-2.png?width=420&height=304&name=image__45_-2.png)

12\. Click **Submit**

You have successfully generated the Lever credentials. You will get a callback URL that needs to be pasted in the webhook configurations on Lever's Integration and API section.

![callbackurl.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/callbackurl-2.png)

To send a HackerEarth test invitation to your candidate from your Lever account, you will need to set up Lever ATS integration. This can be done by following the given steps:  

1.  Navigate to the Lever website and select **Integrations and API**.
2.  The **Signature token** in the below image is the **Webhook Token.** Copy this token and paste it into the Webhook Token box in the HackerEarth Portal.  
    ![A5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A5-2.png)
3.  Click **VERIFY CONNECTION** after putting the Webhook URL in the Webhook Token box**.**

**![A6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A6-2.png)**

**Your connection will be verified.**

markdown:
# Lever: Overview

HackerEarth Assessment has integrated with a new ATS, Lever. This integration allows you to screen candidates efficiently and streamline the technical recruitment workflow. You can perform the following tasks on Lever:

*   Post job requirements on the platform
*   Set up multiple tests on HackerEarth Assessments
*   Invite candidates to tests
*   Generate detailed candidate reports and share the reports with your team members

## Integrating Lever with HackerEarth

To integrate Lever with HackerEarth Assessment and use its features, follow these steps:

1.  [Generate the credentials that are required to log in to Lever](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900007211263-Generating-credentials-for-Lever)
2.  [Send invites to candidates and view candidate reports](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900006197546-Send-invites-from-your-Lever-dashboard)

text:
Send invites from your Lever dashboard
You can send invites from your Lever dashboard by following these steps:
1. Open the lever dashboard and select the job you want to consider the candidate for. You can add a tag manually to the job. This signifies the test id which has been sent to the candidate. For example, HackerEarth-<test id>. Here <test id> refers to the Recruiter API ID of your test.
2. Click on the candidate associated with the selected job.
3. Fill in the details and make sure that the candidate’s 'Trigger stage' is selected as the stage used while setting up the integration process.
4. If the test is sent successfully, you will be able to see a tag HE Test Sent signifying that the test has been sent successfully.
5. You will be able to see the status of the sent invite in the notes section.
6. Once the candidate completes the test, you can see the detailed test report in the notes section. You can also see the link to the report in the links section. 
Note: HE Action Error tag appears when the candidate is already invited or has participated in the test.
markdown:
# Send invites from your Lever dashboard

You can send invites from your Lever dashboard by following these steps:

1\. Open the lever dashboard and select the job you want to consider the candidate for. You can add a tag manually to the job. This signifies the test id which has been sent to the candidate. For example, **_HackerEarth-<test id>_**. Here <test id> refers to the Recruiter API ID of your test.

![tags.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/tags-2.png?width=200&height=82&name=tags-2.png)

2\. Click on the candidate associated with the selected job.

**![image__46_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image__46_-2.png?width=578&height=406&name=image__46_-2.png)**

3\. Fill in the details and make sure that the candidate’s '**Trigger stage**' is selected as the stage used while setting up the integration process.

4\. If the test is sent successfully, you will be able to see a tag **HE Test Sent** signifying that the test has been sent successfully**.**

![A7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/A7-2.png?width=511&height=454&name=A7-2.png)

5\. You will be able to see the status of the sent invite in the notes section.

![image__47___1_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image__47___1_-2.png?width=510&height=511&name=image__47___1_-2.png)

6\. Once the candidate completes the test, you can see the detailed test report in the notes section. You can also see the link to the report in the links section. 

![image__48___1_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image__48___1_-2.png)

_Note_: **HE Action Error** tag appears when the candidate is already invited or has participated in the test**.**

# Linkedin Talent Hub: Overview

HackerEarth Assessment has integrated with Linkedin talent hub. This integration allows you to screen candidates efficiently and streamline the technical recruitment workflow. You can perform the following tasks on Linkedin talent hub:

*   [Send invites to the candidates](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402452912665-Send-invites-to-the-candidates)

# iCIMS: Overview

iCIMS is an applicant tracking system (ATS) that allows you to list tests, send invites, and view candidates' reports in the iCIMS dashboard. The following are the uses of iCIMS:

*   Post job requirements on the platform
*   Set up multiple tests on HackerEarth Assessments
*   Invite candidates to tests
*   Generate detailed candidate reports and share the reports with your team members

## Integrating iCIMS with HackerEarth

To integrate iCIMS with HackerEarth Assessment and use its features, follow these steps:

1\. Generate key

2\. Create job and send invites to candidates

text:
How to integrate with HackerEarth?
HackerEarth has integrated various integrations to conduct your assessments efficiently. You can do the following tasks:
Set up multiple tests on HackerEarth Assessments
Invite candidates to tests
Generate detailed candidate reports and share the reports with your team members
How to integrate with HackerEarth Assessments?
You can easily integrate HackerEarth with any of the available ATS services. 
The flow is as follows:
1. Register the application
This is the first step in the flow. You have to register the application in this step. You need to exchange the client ID and secret key from the ATS and enter the client ID and secret key on HackerEarth’s integration page. You can check for API details here. You have to be an admin to access the APIs. To learn more about how to become an admin, refer to this article.

API details under Personal settings
To learn more about API details, refer to this article.
2. Fetch the assessment
After you have integrated the ATS into the platform, you can easily fetch the required assessments and create job postings on the platform. You can also add the required details to the job and attach the required assessment for the job.
Events list API can be used to fetch all the Invite-only tests within the account.
3. Invite candidates
The next step is to invite the candidates to take the assessment for the job posting done on the platform. You can easily invite the candidates to HackerEarth assessment to take the assessments.
Invite API can be used to invite candidates to the test. Using this API, you can control the following:
If an email has to be sent to the candidate or not
The expiry date of the test
Where the results of the test will be posted
Redirection at the end of the test, etc. 
For live status, you can access relevant webhooks.
4. Candidates take the assessment
After the assessment has been sent to the candidate, the candidate has to attempt the assessment so that the assessment report can be generated. 
5. Post results
After the candidate takes the test, the results are posted by HackerEarth and an assessment report is generated for every candidate who takes the test. In the case of a FaceCode interview, a comprehensive interview summary and report are generated. 
Bulk candidate reports will help you fetch all the candidate reports. For all the details of the candidate's performance made available, check the response in the link for all the details. Further, you have the option to filter based on candidate email IDs as well as the start and end date of the test taken by the candidate.
How to integrate with HackerEarth Interviews?
You can easily integrate HackerEarth with any of the available ATS services.
The flow is as follows:
1. Register the application
This is the first step in the flow. You have to register the application in this step. You need to exchange the client ID and secret key from the ATS and enter the client ID and secret key on HackerEarth’s integration page. You can check for API details here. 
2. Create an Interview
After you have integrated the ATS into the platform, you can easily create the required interview with the necessary details. For example, you can learn about the various steps to create an interview
Create Interview API can be used to create the interview. You can also update the interview details by using Update Interview API.
3. Candidates take the interview
After the interview link has been sent to the candidate, the candidate has to take the interview so that the interview report can be generated. To learn more, check Interview webhooks. 
4. Access reports
After the candidate has completed the interview, the results are posted by HackerEarth and an interview report is generated for every candidate who completes the interview. In the case of a FaceCode interview, a comprehensive interview summary and report are generated. Interview report API can be used to generate interview reports.
\This is how you can easily integrate with various ATS services while taking assessments or FaceCode interviews on the HackerEarth platform.
markdown:
# How to integrate with HackerEarth?

HackerEarth has integrated various integrations to conduct your assessments efficiently. You can do the following tasks:

*   Set up multiple tests on HackerEarth Assessments
*   Invite candidates to tests
*   Generate detailed candidate reports and share the reports with your team members

### **How to integrate with HackerEarth Assessments?**

You can easily integrate HackerEarth with any of the available ATS services.

The flow is as follows:

![image__66_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/12033577406233-2.png?width=480&height=465&name=12033577406233-2.png)

#### **1\. Register the application**

This is the first step in the flow.  You have to register the application in this step. You need to exchange the client ID and secret key from the ATS and enter the client ID and secret key on HackerEarth’s [integration page](https://app.hackerearth.com/recruiter/settings/integrations/). You can check for API details [here](https://app.hackerearth.com/recruiter/settings/api-details/). You have to be an admin to access the APIs. To learn more about how to become an admin, refer to [this article](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360004838434-super-admin).

![Screenshot from 2023-09-07 19-24-20-1](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-24-20-1.png?width=682&height=198&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-09-07%2019-24-20-1.png)  

**API details under Personal settings**

To learn more about API details, refer to this [article](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003337074-personal-settings).

#### **2\. Fetch the assessment**

After you have integrated the ATS into the platform, you can easily fetch the required assessments and create job postings on the platform. You can also add the required details to the job and attach the required assessment for the job.

[Events list API](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/tests/events-list/) can be used to fetch all the Invite-only tests within the account.

#### **3\. Invite candidates**

The next step is to invite the candidates to take the assessment for the job posting done on the platform. You can easily invite the candidates to HackerEarth assessment to take the assessments.

[Invite API](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/tests/invite-candidates/) can be used to invite candidates to the test. Using this API, you can control the following:

*   If an email has to be sent to the candidate or not
*   The expiry date of the test
*   Where the results of the test will be posted
*   Redirection at the end of the test, etc. 

For live status, you can access [relevant webhooks](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/webhooks/recruiter/v1/assessments-webhooks/).

#### **4\. Candidates take the assessment**

After the assessment has been sent to the candidate, the candidate has to attempt the assessment so that the assessment report can be generated. 

#### **5\. Post results**

After the candidate takes the test, the results are posted by HackerEarth and an assessment report is generated for every candidate who takes the test. In the case of a FaceCode interview, a comprehensive interview summary and report are generated. 

[Bulk candidate](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/tests/bulk-candidate-reports/) reports will help you fetch all the candidate reports. For all the details of the candidate's performance made available, check the response in the link for all the details. Further, you have the option to filter based on candidate email IDs as well as the start and end date of the test taken by the candidate.

### How to integrate with HackerEarth Interviews?

You can easily integrate HackerEarth with any of the available ATS services.

The flow is as follows:

![FaceCode Workflow (2)](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/FaceCode%20Workflow%20(2).svg)

#### 1\. Register the application

This is the first step in the flow. You have to register the application in this step. You need to exchange the client ID and secret key from the ATS and enter the client ID and secret key on HackerEarth’s [integration page](https://app.hackerearth.com/recruiter/settings/integrations/). You can check for API details [here](https://app.hackerearth.com/recruiter/settings/api-details/). 

#### 2\. Create an Interview

After you have integrated the ATS into the platform, you can easily create the required interview with the necessary details. For example, you can learn about the various steps to create an interview

[Create Interview API](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/interviews/create-interview/) can be used to create the interview. You can also update the interview details by using [Update Interview API.](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/interviews/update-interview/)

#### 3\. Candidates take the interview

After the interview link has been sent to the candidate, the candidate has to take the interview so that the interview report can be generated. To learn more, check [Interview webhooks](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/webhooks/recruiter/v1/interviews-webhooks/). 

#### 4\. Access reports

After the candidate has completed the interview, the results are posted by HackerEarth and an interview report is generated for every candidate who completes the interview. In the case of a FaceCode interview, a comprehensive interview summary and report are generated. [Interview report API](https://www.hackerearth.com/docs/api/recruiter/v2/interviews/interview-report/) can be used to generate interview reports.

\\This is how you can easily integrate with various ATS services while taking assessments or FaceCode interviews on the HackerEarth platform.

text:
Generating your iCIMS API key and API secret
To generate your iCIMS API key and API secret, follow these steps:
You will have to ask the iCIMS team to create your account.
You will have to ask the iCIMS team to set the Stage name, for triggering the HackerEarth Assessment, as Send HE Test. You also have to ask the iCIMS team for OAuth2.0 credentials.
You will get a customer_id along with a username & password to access the iCIMS Cloud Portal. You will also get client_id and client_secret for OAuth2 to access iCIMS endpoints.
Now, open HackerEarth’s integration page.
Under the iCIMS tab, enter the Client ID, Customer ID, Client Secret and click on Generate.
6. You will get the API Key and API Secret generated at HackerEarth's end. You will need to share the following information with the iCIMS team 
Integration URL: https://api.hackerearth.com/partner/icims/invite/
Access Token URL: https://api.hackerearth.com/partner/icims/verify/
Client ID: HE API Key
Client Secret: HE API Secret
Note: Earlier HackerEarth used to consume Customer ID, Username, and Password for authentication but now, only Customer ID, Client ID, and Client Secret are required.
markdown:
# Generating your iCIMS API key and API secret

To generate your iCIMS API key and API secret, follow these steps:

*   1.  You will have to ask the iCIMS team to **create your account.**
    2.  You will have to ask the iCIMS team to set the Stage name, for triggering the HackerEarth Assessment, as **Send HE Test.** You also have to ask the iCIMS team for OAuth2.0 credentials.
    3.  You will get a customer\_id along with a username & password to access the iCIMS Cloud Portal. You will also get _client\_id_ and _client\_secret_ for OAuth2 to access iCIMS endpoints.
    4.  Now, open [HackerEarth’s integration page](https://app.hackerearth.com/recruiter/settings/integrations/).
    5.  Under the iCIMS tab, enter the Client ID, Customer ID, Client Secret and click on **Generate**.
*   ![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_17-31-12.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_17-31-12-1.png) 6. You will get the API Key and API Secret generated at HackerEarth's end. You will need to share the following information with the iCIMS team
    
    *   Integration URL: [https://api.hackerearth.com/partner/icims/invite/](https://api.hackerearth.com/partner/icims/invite/)
    *   Access Token URL: [https://api.hackerearth.com/partner/icims/verify/](https://api.hackerearth.com/partner/icims/verify/)
    *   Client ID: HE API Key
    *   Client Secret: HE API Secret
    
    **Note**: Earlier HackerEarth used to consume Customer ID, Username, and Password for authentication but now, only Customer ID, Client ID, and Client Secret are required.

metadata.title: Sending Adhoc test invite
metadata.description: HackerEarth allows you to send Adhoc tests based on performance and profile to assess a particular candidate. For example, the candidate has applied for a role but you want them to take up another tes

openGraph.content: HackerEarth allows you to send Adhoc tests based on performance and profile to assess a particular candidate. For example, the candidate has applied for a role but you want them to take up another tes

text:
Sending Adhoc test invite
HackerEarth allows you to send Adhoc tests based on performance and profile to assess a particular candidate. For example, the candidate has applied for a role but you want them to take up another test to assess their skills better then you can send an Adhoc test to them. The process is as follows:
1.Click on the assessment link which will appear on the screen.
2. You will be redirected to the Test invite dashboard.
3. Fill in all the necessary details and send the invite. Your candidate has been invited to the test which you have selected.
4. Once you have invited the candidate through the link, the link gets removed from the Lever dashboard.
Note: Invite page link fails to appear when the configuration is not set up properly which includes not adding HE callback URL on Lever or error in manually pasting the webhook token.
The candidate receives two test links in this case and you can tell the candidate which test they have to take to complete their assssment. It is a very useful feature to assess a candidate efficiently.
markdown:
# Sending Adhoc test invite

HackerEarth allows you to send Adhoc tests based on performance and profile to assess a particular candidate. For example, the candidate has applied for a role but you want them to take up another test to assess their skills better then you can send an Adhoc test to them. The process is as follows:

1.Click on the assessment link which will appear on the screen.

![L1__1_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/L1__1_-2.png)

2\. You will be redirected to the Test invite dashboard.

3\. Fill in all the necessary details and send the invite. Your candidate has been invited to the test which you have selected.

![invite.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/invite-2.png)

4\. Once you have invited the candidate through the link, the link gets removed from the Lever dashboard.

![image__51___1___1_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/image__51___1___1_-2.png)

_Note_: Invite page link fails to appear when the configuration is not set up properly which includes not adding HE callback URL on Lever or error in manually pasting the webhook token.

The candidate receives two test links in this case and you can tell the candidate which test they have to take to complete their assssment. It is a very useful feature to assess a candidate efficiently.

text:
Send invites to the candidates
You can send invites from your Linkedin Talent Hub dashboard by following these steps:
1. Open your Linkedin dashboard and click on any of the candidates which have been added to the dashboard.
2. Click to see a list of features. You can Schedule interviews, Provide feedback, Send assessment, etc. Click on Send assessment.
3. You can select any of the assessments from the drop-down list. You can also search for the assessments if it is not visible in the drop-down list.
4. Once you have sent the assessment, the details of the assessment can be seen.
Note: The details include score which depends on the cut-off score set for the assessment, report which is not shareable and status of the test. 
This is how you can easily send invites to the candidates from your Linkedin Talent Hub dashboard.
markdown:
# Send invites to the candidates

You can send invites from your Linkedin Talent Hub dashboard by following these steps:

1\. Open your Linkedin dashboard and click on any of the candidates which have been added to the dashboard.

2\. Click ![L5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/L5-1.png) to see a list of features. You can Schedule interviews, Provide feedback, Send assessment, etc. Click on **Send assessment**.

![L6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/L6-1.png)

3\. You can select any of the assessments from the drop-down list. You can also search for the assessments if it is not visible in the drop-down list.

![L7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/L7-1.png)

4\. Once you have sent the assessment, the details of the assessment can be seen.

_Note_: The details include score which depends on the cut-off score set for the assessment, report which is not shareable and status of the test. 

![L8.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/L8-1.png)

This is how you can easily send invites to the candidates from your Linkedin Talent Hub dashboard.

text:
Sending assessments to candidates and viewing report
You can send assessments to the candidates from the JazzHR portal by following these steps:
1. View the job roles that are open and check the workflow status of candidates who have been sourced for the role.
2. Click candidates’ name and view their profile.
3. In a candidate’s profile, click Send HackerEarth under the Assessments tab.
4. Select the most appropriate test from the list.
5. Customize the email template and choose the date and time to send the invite.
Your invite will be sent to the candidate.
View candidate report
Once a candidate has completed an assessment, you will receive an email with the test score. 
You can follow these steps to view the candidate's performance report:
1. Visit the candidate profile and view the test score and test completion date.
2. Click View details to view the results externally on the HackerEarth Assessment platform. This link can be shared via public access.
markdown:
# Sending assessments to candidates and viewing report

You can send assessments to the candidates from the JazzHR portal by following these steps:

1\. View the job roles that are open and check the workflow status of candidates who have been sourced for the role.

2\. Click candidates’ name and view their profile.

3\. In a candidate’s profile, click _**Send HackerEarth**_ under the _**Assessments**_ tab.

![j4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j4-1.png)

4\. Select the most appropriate test from the list.

![j5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j5-1.png)

5\. Customize the email template and choose the date and time to send the invite.

![j6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j6-1.png)

Your invite will be sent to the candidate.

![j7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j7-1.png)

## View candidate report

Once a candidate has completed an assessment, you will receive an email with the test score.

![j8.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j8-1.png)

You can follow these steps to view the candidate's performance report:

1\. Visit the candidate profile and view the test score and test completion date.

![j9.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j9-1.png)

2\. Click **_View details_** to view the results externally on the HackerEarth Assessment platform. This link can be shared via public access. 

![j1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/j1-1.png)

markdown:
# Zoho Recruit: Overview

_This is a premium feature. To enable this feature, contact [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com)._

HackerEarth Assessment has integrated with a new ATS—Zoho Recruit. This integration allows you to screen candidates efficiently and streamline the technical recruitment workflow. You can perform the following tasks on SuccessFactors:

*   Post job requirements on the Zoho Recruit platform.
*   List the HE tests that you have created at the Zoho Recruit dashboard and associate them with various jobs.
*   Send invites to candidates directly from the Zoho Recruit dashboard.
*   View the candidate report on the Zoho Recruit dashboard after the candidate successfully completes the test at HackerEarth Assessment.
*   Get a public link to view the candidate reports at HackerEarth Assessment.

Integrating Zoho Recruit with HackerEarth

To integrate Zoho with HackerEarth Assessment and use its features, follow these steps:

1.  [Generate the credentials that are required to log in to Zoho Recruit.](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900002048506-generating-the-credentials-of-zoho-recruit)
2.  [Send invites to candidates and view candidate reports](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900002047543-sending-invites-to-candidates-and-viewing-candidate-reports)

text:
Creating jobs on the iCIMS portal
You can create Jobs on the iCIMS portal by following these steps:
1. In the iCIMS cloud portal, click Create and select Job.
2. Add the relevant Job details.
3. Under the Screening section, select Assessment Type.
4. Select the HackerEarth test that needs to be assigned for the Job and save it.
Note: For this, you need to create the test first in HackerEarth. You will create a test in HackerEarth and then events (Vendor Packages) will get pushed to your iCIMS cloud portal.
5. The portal also allows you to add multiple assessments for the job but HackerEarth only considers the first assessment and the invitation is sent for that assessment only.
Note: Resetting the invite/participation from the HackerEarth portal will not delete the previous reports at the iCIMS candidate dashboard.
markdown:
# Creating jobs on the iCIMS portal

You can create Jobs on the iCIMS portal by following these steps:

1\. In the iCIMS cloud portal, click **Create** and select **Job**.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-34-06.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-34-06-1.png)

2\. Add the relevant Job details.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-36-19.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-36-19-1.png)

3\. Under the **Screening** section, select **Assessment** Type.

4\. Select the HackerEarth test that needs to be assigned for the Job and save it.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-12_02-08-53.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-12_02-08-53-1.png)

Note: For this, you need to create the test first in HackerEarth. You will create a test in HackerEarth and then events (Vendor Packages) will get pushed to your iCIMS cloud portal.

5\. The portal also allows you to add multiple assessments for the job but HackerEarth only considers the first assessment and the invitation is sent for that assessment only.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-17_14-46-31__1_.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-17_14-46-31__1_-1.png)

**Note:** Resetting the invite/participation from the HackerEarth portal will not delete the previous reports at the iCIMS candidate dashboard.

text:
Enabling and disabling the integration of Workable with HackerEarth
To enable the integration, follow these steps:
Log in to the Workable platform by using your HackerEarth's admin email ID. 
Click the user icon, that is available on the upper right corner of the page.
Click Integrations.
Click HackerEarth.
Enter the generated API key in the Key field.
Click Update settings.
You have successfully integrated HackerEarth with Workable. A confirmation page depicting various options is displayed on your screen.
Disabling the integration 
To disable the integration, follow these steps:
Log in to the Workable platform by using your HackerEarth's admin email ID. 
Click the user icon, that is available on the upper right corner of the page.
Click Integrations.
Click HackerEarth.
Click Disable integrations that is available on the left corner of the HackerEarth section.
You have successfully disabled the integration.
markdown:
# Enabling and disabling the integration of Workable with HackerEarth

To enable the integration, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to the Workable platform by using your HackerEarth's admin email ID. 
2.  Click the user icon, ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-37-18-8734-AM.png) that is available on the upper right corner of the page.
3.  Click Integrations.
4.  Click **HackerEarth**.  
    ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-37-17-6395-AM.png)
5.  Enter the generated API key in the **Key** field.  
    ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-37-22-5702-AM.png)
6.  Click **Update settings**.  
    ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-37-20-0099-AM.png)

You have successfully integrated HackerEarth with Workable. A confirmation page depicting various options is displayed on your screen.

![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-37-21-3845-AM.png)

## Disabling the integration 

To disable the integration, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to the Workable platform by using your HackerEarth's admin email ID. 
2.  Click the user icon, ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-37-18-8734-AM.png) that is available on the upper right corner of the page.
3.  Click **Integrations**.
4.  Click **HackerEarth**.
5.  Click **Disable integrations** that is available on the left corner of the HackerEarth section.

You have successfully disabled the integration.

To generate the Zoho Recruit credentials, follow these steps:
Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.

markdown:
# Generating the credentials of Zoho Recruit

To generate the Zoho Recruit credentials, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to your HackerEarth Assessment account using your admin credentials.

markdown:
# Workable: Overview

HackerEarth Assessment has integrated with a new ATS, Workable. This integration allows you to screen candidates efficiently and streamline the technical recruitment workflow. You can perform the following tasks on Workable:

*   Post job requirements on the platform
*   Set up tests and live interviews on HackerEarth Assessments
*   Invite candidates to tests and interviews
*   Generate detailed candidate reports and share the reports with your team members

To integrate Workable with HackerEarth Assessment, follow these steps:

1.  [Generate the Workable API key for your organization](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035345193-generating-the-workable-api-key-for-your-organization). 
2.  [Enable and implement the integration of Workable to HackerEarth](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034851814-enabling-and-disabling-the-integration-of-workable-with-hackerearth).
3.  [Set up assessments on the Workable platform](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035355833-setting-up-assessments-in-workable).
4.  [Send assessments to candidates and share detailed reports to your team members](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360035426313-sending-assessments-to-candidates-and-sharing-detailed-reports-to-your-team-members).

Inviting Candidates on the iCIMS portal
You can invite candidates on the iCIMS portal, follow these steps:
1. In the iCIMS cloud portal, click Create and select Person.
2. Create a Candidate in the iCIMS cloud portal.
3. Now, you need to add a candidate and link him/her to the job. Click job and select More Actions.
4. Click Find Other Candidates.
5. Select the candidate and Advance him/her to Send HE Test.
6. A pop-up window will appear, with a success message or an error message.
7. An invitation will be sent to the candidate through the mail.
8. Once the candidate finishes the assessment, the report will be pushed to the iCIMS cloud portal under the candidate dashboard.
9. Go to the candidate dashboard and click the Screen tab.
10. Now, click the Assessments sub-tab and you can see the candidate’s report.
Note: If you wish to test the integration, do not send an invite to another admin. You can send the invite to the non-admin to test the integration.
markdown:
# Inviting Candidates on the iCIMS portal

You can invite candidates on the iCIMS portal, follow these steps:

1\. In the iCIMS cloud portal, click **Create** and select **Person.**

2\. Create a **Candidate** in the iCIMS cloud portal.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-45-53.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-45-53-1.png)

3\. Now, you need to add a candidate and link him/her to the job. Click **job** and select **More Actions.**

4\. Click **Find Other Candidates.**

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-50-49.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-50-49-1.png)

5\. Select the candidate and Advance him/her to **Send HE Test.**

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-58-22.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_16-58-22-1.png)

6\. A pop-up window will appear, with a success message or an error message.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-12_02-27-36.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-12_02-27-36-1.png)

7\. An invitation will be sent to the candidate through the mail.

8\. Once the candidate finishes the assessment, the report will be pushed to the iCIMS cloud portal under the candidate dashboard.

9\. Go to the candidate dashboard and click the Screen tab.

![Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_13-07-06.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/Screenshot_from_2022-08-16_13-07-06-1.png)

10\. Now, click the Assessments sub-tab and you can see the candidate’s report.

**Note**: If you wish to test the integration, do not send an invite to another admin. You can send the invite to the non-admin to test the integration.

# Sending assessments to candidates and sharing detailed reports to your team members

    ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-37-05-6452-AM.png)

Sharing candidate reports

You can share the candidate reports with your team members from your HackerEarth account.

markdown:
# SmartRecruiters: Overview

HackerEarth Assessment is integrated with a new ATS—SmartRecruiters. This integration allows you to screen candidates efficiently and streamline the technical recruitment workflow. You can perform the following tasks on SmartRecruiters:

*   Post job requirements on the platform
*   Set up multiple tests on HackerEarth Assessments
*   Invite candidates to Assessments and FaceCode interview

text:
Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire: Overview
HackerEarth has added Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire ATS to its extensive list of ATS integrations. Recruiterbox is a popular and user-friendly ATS software that enables organizations to find and hire talent faster.
The integration between HackerEarth and Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire allows you to streamline the technical recruitment workflow. Using this integration, you can post about job openings on Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire, set up HackerEarth tests, invite candidates, and generate and share detailed candidate reports with your team. 
Integration of HackerEarth with Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire 
To integrate HackerEarth with Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire, follow these steps:
Enter the API key to log in to the Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire platform.
Note: Customers who have the Pro Plus subscription of Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire have access to utilize their API. If you have their Standard subscription, you cannot use the API.
Create job openings for candidates on the Recruiterbox platform.
Source candidates to job openings and access their reports.
markdown:
# Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire: Overview

HackerEarth has added Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire ATS to its extensive list of ATS integrations. Recruiterbox is a popular and user-friendly ATS software that enables organizations to find and hire talent faster.

The integration between HackerEarth and Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire allows you to streamline the technical recruitment workflow. Using this integration, you can post about job openings on Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire, set up HackerEarth tests, invite candidates, and generate and share detailed candidate reports with your team. 

Integration of HackerEarth with Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire

To integrate HackerEarth with Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire, follow these steps:

1.  Enter the API key to log in to the Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire platform.

**Note**: **Customers who have the Pro Plus subscription of Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire have access to utilize their API. If you have their Standard subscription, you cannot use the API.**![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-45-30-8070-AM.png)

1.  [Create job openings for candidates on the Recruiterbox platform](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900002047583-creating-job-openings-for-candidates-in-recruiterbox-trakstar-hire).
2.  [Source candidates to job openings and access their reports](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900002048806-sourcing-candidates-to-job-openings-and-accessing-their-results).

text:
Setting up assessments in Workable
To set up assessments in Workable, follow these steps:
Create a new job on the Workable platform.
Navigate to the Assessment section.
Select the appropriate stage from the dropdown menu through which you want to assess candidates, Phone Screen or Interview.
Note: The assessment tests are associated with these stages.
Click Continue.
Click Assessment test to evaluate candidates at this stage.
Select the suitable test that you want the candidates to attempt.
Click Save Changes.
You have successfully set up an assessment on Workable. Now, you can invite candidates to take your test.
Adding multiple stages in your recruitment workflow
You can also add multiple stages in your job requirement. To add another stage in your assessment process, follow these steps:
Click Add another evaluation method that is available on the right side of the page.
Repeat Steps 1 to 7 from the Setting up assessments section.
You have successfully added another stage in your recruitment workflow.
Editing or deleting a test
To edit a test, follow these steps:
Log in to Workable by using your valid credentials.
Click Jobs on the top-right corner of the page.
Navigate to a job whose test you want to edit.
Click that is available on the right-most corner of specific jobs.
Click Edit job.
Navigate to the Assessments section.
Hover over the test to view the icon to edit or delete the test.
Click to edit the test.
Select a suitable test that you want to add.
Click Save Changes.
You have successfully edited the test.
To delete a test, follow these steps:
Repeat Steps 1 to 7 from the Editing a test section.
Click .
A confirmation message is displayed on your screen. Click Delete.
You have successfully deleted the test.
markdown:
# Setting up assessments in Workable

To set up assessments in Workable, follow these steps:

1.  Create a new job on the Workable platform.
2.  Navigate to the **Assessment** section.
3.  Select the appropriate stage from the dropdown menu through which you want to assess candidates, **Phone Screen** or **Interview**.  
    **Note**: The assessment tests are associated with these stages.  
    ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-30-12-9563-AM.png)
4.  Click **Continue**.
5.  Click **Assessment test** to evaluate candidates at this stage.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-30-02-5175-AM.png)
6.  Select the suitable test that you want the candidates to attempt.  
    ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-30-07-9767-AM.png)
7.  Click **Save Changes**.

You have successfully set up an assessment on Workable. Now, you can invite candidates to take your test.

## Adding multiple stages in your recruitment workflow

You can also add multiple stages in your job requirement. To add another stage in your assessment process, follow these steps:

1.  Click **Add another evaluation method** that is available on the right side of the page.  
    ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-30-09-2110-AM.png)
2.  Repeat **Steps 1** to **7** from the _Setting up assessments_ section.

You have successfully added another stage in your recruitment workflow.

## Editing or deleting a test

To edit a test, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to Workable by using your valid credentials.
2.  Click **Jobs** on the top-right corner of the page.  
    ![mceclip5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-30-11-4826-AM.png)
3.  Navigate to a job whose test you want to edit.
4.  Click ![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip6-Jan-30-2023-11-30-14-6267-AM.png) that is available on the right-most corner of specific jobs.
5.  Click **Edit job**.
6.  Navigate to the **Assessments** section.
7.  Hover over the test to view the icon to edit or delete the test.  
    ![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-30-04-0644-AM.png)
8.  Click ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-30-05-2807-AM.png) to edit the test.
9.  Select a suitable test that you want to add.
10.  Click **Save Changes**.

You have successfully edited the test.

To delete a test, follow these steps:

1.  Repeat Steps **1** to **7** from the _Editing a test_ section.
2.  Click ![mceclip7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-30-06-5172-AM.png).
3.  A confirmation message is displayed on your screen. Click **Delete**.  
    ![mceclip9.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip9-Jan-30-2023-11-30-10-3353-AM.png)

You have successfully deleted the test.

text:
Integrating assessments with SmartRecruiters
You can integrate assessments with SmartRecruiters by following these steps:
Open SmartRecruiters platform.
Go to Apps & Integrations and search HackerEarth application.
Click Connect
You have to give the mentioned permissions to HackerEarth. Click Allow and continue.
The permission request will be transferred to the HackerEarth platform. Open the HackerEarth administrator dashboard and authorize the request.
You have successfully integrated assessments with SmartRecruiters.
Integration workflow
To invite candidates for assessments from SmartRecruiters, follow these steps:
Open the SmartRecruiters dashboard.
To create a job, click Job.
Click Add candidate to add a candidate to the job.
Click the candidate’s profile and select browse assessments. You can see a list of HackerEarth Assessments. Select any one of the assessments. Click Continue.
Once you select the assessment, we will send an invite to the candidate.
Once the candidate completes the assessment, we will update the assessment report and candidate score.
markdown:
# Integrating assessments with SmartRecruiters

You can integrate assessments with SmartRecruiters by following these steps:

1.  Open SmartRecruiters platform.
2.  Go to **Apps & Integrations** and search **HackerEarth** application**.![Screenshot from 2023-03-24 14-36-42](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-24%2014-36-42.png?width=688&height=124&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-24%2014-36-42.png)**
3.  Click **Connect![Screenshot from 2023-03-24 14-36-59](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-24%2014-36-59.png?width=688&height=178&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-24%2014-36-59.png)**
4.  You have to give the mentioned permissions to HackerEarth. Click **Allow and continue**.![Screenshot from 2023-03-28 12-56-02](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-56-02.png?width=597&height=322&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-56-02.png)
5.  The permission request will be transferred to the HackerEarth platform. Open the HackerEarth administrator dashboard and authorize the request.  
    ![Screenshot from 2023-03-28 12-57-14](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-57-14.png?width=688&height=116&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-57-14.png)

You have successfully integrated assessments with SmartRecruiters.

**Integration workflow**

To invite candidates for assessments from SmartRecruiters, follow these steps:

1.  Open the SmartRecruiters dashboard.
2.  To create a job, click **Job**.
3.  Click **Add candidate** to add a candidate to the job**.**
4.  Click the candidate’s profile and select browse assessments. You can see a list of HackerEarth Assessments. Select any one of the assessments. Click **Continue.**  
    ![Screenshot from 2023-03-28 12-57-55](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-57-55.png?width=688&height=481&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-57-55.png)
5.  Once you select the assessment, we will send an invite to the candidate.
6.  Once the candidate completes the assessment, we will update the assessment report and candidate score.

![Screenshot from 2023-03-28 12-58-42](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-58-42.png?width=340&height=412&name=Screenshot%20from%202023-03-28%2012-58-42.png)

Sending invites to candidates and viewing candidate reports

text:
Sending invites to candidates and viewing candidate reports
Prerequisites: You must generate the Client ID and Client Secret ID of Zoho Recruit.
To configure HackerEarth with Zoho Recruit, follow these steps:
Install the HackerEarth extension from Zoho Marketplace or by using a private link that is provided by HackerEarth. Click Install Now.

Enter HackerEarth_Client_ID (Client ID) and HackerEarth_Secret (Client Secret) as displayed on the Integration page of HackerEarth. 

Click Save.
You have successfully configured HackerEarth with Zoho Recruit.
To send invites to candidates and view candidates' report after they have completed the test, follow these steps:
Go to the Candidate module in Candidates. Click the name of the candidate.
Click Send HackerEarth Tests at the top-right corner of your screen. A new tab is opened.

Select the appropriate details and click Initiate Assessment. The page gets automatically closed and you get redirected to Zoho Recruit.

You can see the candidate report by following these two steps: 
Go to the Candidate details page and scroll down the page. Now, you can see the candidate report URL.

Click on the top side of the screen. Now, click the name of the assessment from the displayed list of assessments. Scroll down the page to view the URL to the candidate report.

Note: If you wish to test the integration, do not send an invite to another admin. You can send the invite to the non-admin to test the integration.
markdown:
# Sending invites to candidates and viewing candidate reports

_Prerequisites: You must generate the Client ID and Client Secret ID of Zoho Recruit._

To configure HackerEarth with Zoho Recruit, follow these steps:

1.  Install the HackerEarth extension from Zoho Marketplace or by using a private link that is provided by HackerEarth. Click **Install Now**.  
    ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-36-07-2950-AM.png)  
    
2.  Enter **HackerEarth\_Client\_ID** (Client ID) and **HackerEarth\_Secret** (Client Secret) as displayed on the Integration page of HackerEarth.   
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-35-59-9075-AM.png) 
3.  Click **Save**.

You have successfully configured HackerEarth with Zoho Recruit.

To send invites to candidates and view candidates' report after they have completed the test, follow these steps:

1.  Go to the Candidate module in Candidates. Click the name of the candidate.
2.  Click **Send HackerEarth Tests** at the top-right corner of your screen. A new tab is opened.  
    ![2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184424140569-3.png?width=695&height=102&name=13184424140569-3.png)  
    
3.  Select the appropriate details and click **Initiate Assessment**. The page gets automatically closed and you get redirected to Zoho Recruit.  
    ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-36-05-8177-AM.png)  
    
4.  You can see the candidate report by following these two steps:
    1.  Go to the Candidate details page and scroll down the page. Now, you can see the candidate report URL.  
        ![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip6-Jan-30-2023-11-36-01-2823-AM.png)  
        
    2.  Click ![mceclip7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-36-04-3346-AM.png) on the top side of the screen. Now, click the name of the assessment from the displayed list of assessments. Scroll down the page to view the URL to the candidate report.  
        ![mceclip8.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip8-Jan-30-2023-11-36-03-1573-AM.png)

metadata.title: SmartRecruiters FaceCode integration
metadata.description: You can integrate FaceCode interview with SmartRecruiters by following these steps: You have successfully integrated FaceCode with SmartRecruiters. Integration workflow To invite candidates for FaceCo

openGraph.content: You can integrate FaceCode interview with SmartRecruiters by following these steps: You have successfully integrated FaceCode with SmartRecruiters. Integration workflow To invite candidates for FaceCo

text:
SmartRecruiters FaceCode integration
You can integrate FaceCode interview with SmartRecruiters by following these steps:
Open HackerEarth’s integration page from the administrator dashboard.
Click Connect FaceCode.
The request will be sent to the SmartRecruiters platform. Open the platform and accept the request by clicking Allow Access.
You have successfully integrated FaceCode with SmartRecruiters. 
Integration workflow
To invite candidates for FaceCode interview from SmartRecruiters, follow these steps:
You have to add a custom step in the hiring process. Enter HE_INTERVIEW followed by any number or text.
You have to update the status of the candidate to HE_INTERVIEW by clicking Move Forward and selecting HE_INTERVIEW 1.
HackerEarth will create a FaceCode interview and share an invite with the candidate. 
The interview link will also be pushed to the candidate’s notes section for you to share with interviewers.
Once the candidate completes the interview, the report will be pushed to the notes section.

openGraph.content: HackerEarth has integrated FaceCode with Zoho. You can follow these steps to send the FaceCode invites: 1. Select the Candidate module in Candidates. Click the name of the candidate. 2. Click Invite t

text:
Zoho FaceCode integration
HackerEarth has integrated FaceCode with Zoho. You can follow these steps to send the FaceCode invites:
1. Select the Candidate module in Candidates. Click the name of the candidate.

2. Click Invite to FaceCode at the top-right corner of your screen to send an Interview. A new tab will get opened.
4. Select the appropriate details and click on Invite Candidate. The new tab automatically closes and you will get redirected to Zoho Recruit.
5. An interview mail will be shared with the candidate as well as the interviewer with the interview URL
Access candidate report
1. Go to the Candidate details page and click the Interview tab on the left panel. Now, you can see all the candidate interviews.
2. Select the interview for which the candidate interview report needs to be seen.
3. Once the interview is selected, you will get the initial candidate interview report. The interview status will be Interview Sent.
4. Once the interview is over, the interview status will change to Interview Completed and all the other details will get pushed to the same interface.
5. To access the Interview rating and comments, you need to access the notes section present at the top of the left navigation tab.
markdown:
# Zoho FaceCode integration

HackerEarth has integrated FaceCode with Zoho. You can follow these steps to send the FaceCode invites:

1\. Select the Candidate module in **Candidates**. Click the name of the candidate.  
![1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184424153625-1.png)  
2\. Click **Invite to FaceCode** at the top-right corner of your screen to send an Interview. A new tab will get opened.

![2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184424140569-2.png?width=687&height=101&name=13184424140569-2.png)

4\. Select the appropriate details and click on **Invite Candidate**. The new tab automatically closes and you will get redirected to Zoho Recruit.

![3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184423950361-1.png?width=541&height=431&name=13184423950361-1.png)

5\. An interview mail will be shared with the candidate as well as the interviewer with the interview URL

## Access candidate report

1\. Go to the Candidate details page and click the **Interview** tab on the left panel. Now, you can see all the candidate interviews.

![4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184399161881-1.png?width=361&height=391&name=13184399161881-1.png)

2\. Select the interview for which the candidate interview report needs to be seen.

3\. Once the interview is selected, you will get the initial candidate interview report. The interview status will be **Interview Sent**.

![5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184423750297-1.png)

4\. Once the interview is over, the interview status will change to **Interview Completed** and all the other details will get pushed to the same interface.  
5\. To access the Interview rating and comments, you need to access the notes section present at the top of the left navigation tab.

![6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/13184398932761-1.png)

markdown:
# Creating job openings for candidates in Recruiterbox

_Prerequisites: You have logged in to Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire by using the API key._

To create job openings for candidates in Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire, follow these steps:

1.  Create a custom configuration that must be done for successful integration.
2.  Add the custom stages for the process of technical recruitment. The 4 stages that have to be added mandatorily are as follows:
    
    *   Send HE Test
    *   HE Test Sent
    *   HE Test Completed
    *   ATS Integration Error
    
      
    ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-39-10-2620-AM.png)
3.  Add the **HackerEarth** tag to job openings.
4.  Add a custom private field, **HE Assessment ID**, for a job opening in the **Additional Details** section.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-39-11-7122-AM.png)

You have successfully posted a job opening on the Recruiterbox - Trakstar Hire platform.

text:
Sourcing candidates to job openings and accessing their results
To invite candidates to a test, associate candidates to job openings, and provide results to candidates, follow these steps:
When candidates are moved to the Send HE Test, HackerEarth's cron fetches their details and send them an invite to the test. Now, the candidate status is changed to HE Test Sent on the Candidate Details page. 
After candidates complete the test, their reports are available in the Candidate details page. Now, their status is changed to HE Test Completed.
You can successfully view candidates' reports on the platform. 
If there are any errors while inviting candidates, then candidates area moved to the ATS Integration Error stage. The error message is displayed on the HE Error field.
markdown:
# Sourcing candidates to job openings and accessing their results

To invite candidates to a test, associate candidates to job openings, and provide results to candidates, follow these steps:

1.  When candidates are moved to the **Send HE Test**, HackerEarth's cron fetches their details and send them an invite to the test. Now, the candidate status is changed to **HE Test Sent** on the **Candidate Details** page.   
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-44-37-7847-AM.png)
2.  After candidates complete the test, their reports are available in the Candidate details page. Now, their status is changed to **HE Test Completed**.

You can successfully view candidates' reports on the platform. 

If there are any errors while inviting candidates, then candidates area moved to the **ATS Integration Error** stage. The error message is displayed on the HE Error field.

![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-44-39-0932-AM.png)
