text:
I am not able to access the webcam. What should I do?
The Camera Permissions dialog box will not be displayed when the status of the camera is disabled. Follow these steps to enable camera permissions on different browsers:
Google Chrome
On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open permission dialog.
Select Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your camera.
Click Done.
For more details, read this.
Mozilla Firefox
On the Address bar, click .
Click to enable camera permissions.
Note: The ‘You may need to reload the page for changes to apply’ message will be displayed on the screen.
Click .
Click Allow in the dialog box that is displayed on the screen.
For more details, read this.
Edge
Open the test link in Microsoft Edge.
If the webcam is disabled, then the following dialog box appears on your screen:
Click .
Select the checkbox beside Always allow https://www.hackerearth.com to access your camera.
Click Done.
Safari
Click Safari.
Click Preference to open the Preference window.
On the Toolbar, click Websites.
In the General section, click Camera.
In the Currently Open Websites window, select Allow beside hackerearth.com.
Close the window and refresh the page.
For more details, read this.
If this does not fix your webcam issue, try this.
markdown:
# I am not able to access the webcam. What should I do?

The Camera Permissions dialog box will not be displayed when the status of the camera is disabled. Follow these steps to enable camera permissions on different browsers:

### Google Chrome

1.  On the Taskbar, click the camera icon to open permission dialog.
2.  Select **Always allow http://hackerearth.com to access your camera**.  
    ![mceclip1.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip1-Jan-30-2023-11-43-24-9592-AM.png)
3.  Click **Done**.

For more details, read [this](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900000260863-troubleshooting-camera-permissions).

### Mozilla Firefox

1.  On the Address bar, click ![mceclip2.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip2-Jan-30-2023-11-43-30-2915-AM.png).
    
    ![mceclip3.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip3-Jan-30-2023-11-43-26-3165-AM.png)
    
2.  Click ![mceclip4.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip4-Jan-30-2023-11-43-27-5968-AM.png) to enable camera permissions.  
    **Note**: The ‘**You may need to reload the page for changes to apply**’ message will be displayed on the screen.
3.  Click ![mceclip5.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip5-Jan-30-2023-11-43-31-3970-AM.png).
4.  Click **Allow** in the dialog box that is displayed on the screen.  
    ![mceclip6.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip6-Jan-30-2023-11-43-34-0798-AM.png)

For more details, read [this](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900000260863-troubleshooting-camera-permissions).

### Edge

1.  Open the test link in Microsoft Edge.
2.  If the webcam is disabled, then the following dialog box appears on your screen:  
    ![mceclip7.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip7-Jan-30-2023-11-43-35-3414-AM.png)
3.  Click ![mceclip8.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip8-Jan-30-2023-11-43-36-5658-AM.png).
4.  Select the checkbox beside **Always allow [https://www.hackerearth.com](https://www.hackerearth.com/) to access your camera**.  
    ![mceclip9.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip9-Jan-30-2023-11-43-28-6862-AM.png)
5.  Click **Done**.

### Safari

1.  Click Safari.
2.  Click **Preference** to open the **Preference** window.
3.  On the Toolbar, click **Websites**.
4.  In the **General** section, click **Camera**.
5.  In the **Currently Open Websites** window, select **Allow** beside hackerearth.com.
6.  Close the window and refresh the page.  
    ![mceclip10.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip10-Jan-30-2023-11-43-32-8365-AM.png)

For more details, read [this](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900000260863-troubleshooting-camera-permissions).

If this does not fix your webcam issue, try [this](https://help.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/900000260863-troubleshooting-camera-permissions).

markdown:
# Who, from HackerEarth, has access to candidate data?

Nobody from HackerEarth has direct access to any candidate’s personally-identifiable data. However, in case you raise support requests, for which we have to access data in order to understand the issue better, then the support agent will have temporary access to that data only.

text:
Even though I have set the camera permissions to Allowed, the compatibility check fails. What do I do?
Check if the camera is being used in multiple tabs or browsers. If yes, then close the tabs (or browsers) and refresh the test page.
Your system will now meet the system-compatibility requirements for the webcam and you will be able to proceed.
If this option does not work, close and re-open your browser.
markdown:
# Even though I have set the camera permissions to Allowed, the compatibility check fails. What do I do?

Check if the camera is being used in multiple tabs or browsers. If yes, then close the tabs (or browsers) and refresh the test page.

Your system will now meet the system-compatibility requirements for the webcam and you will be able to proceed.

If this option does not work, close and re-open your browser.

text:
I am being prompted to enable my webcam, even though it is working fine. How do I resolve this issue?
When the network is unstable or has high latency, the webcam fails to record snapshots and the following error is displayed on the screen:
You can do any one or all of the following to resolve this:
Check your router and your Internet connection to verify your network stability.
Press Ctrl + Shift + R to refresh the page.
Check whether the camera is being used by other applications. If yes, then close the other applications and refresh the test page.
If the issue still persists, close the test window and launch again.
If this did not fix your webcam issue, contact support@hackerearth.com by creating a ticket from the on the test page.
markdown:
# I am being prompted to enable my webcam, even though it is working fine. How do I resolve this issue?

When the network is unstable or has high latency, the webcam fails to record snapshots and the following error is displayed on the screen:

![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-31-44-4069-AM.png)

You can do any one or all of the following to resolve this:

*   Check your router and your Internet connection to verify your network stability.
*   Press **Ctrl + Shift + R** to refresh the page.
*   Check whether the camera is being used by other applications. If yes, then close the other applications and refresh the test page.
*   If the issue still persists, close the test window and launch again.

If this did not fix your webcam issue, contact [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com) by creating a ticket from the ![mceclip0.png](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-31-45-7278-AM.png?width=33&height=30&name=mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-31-45-7278-AM.png) on the test page.

Do you maintain an audit log of all the activities of each candidate who takes the test?
Yes, HackerEarth maintains an audit log of all the admins in a company. You can ask us for these audit logs by sending an email to support@hackerearth.com.
Another way to request the logs is through your Customer Success Manager or Account Manager if you have one assigned to you.
markdown:
# Do you maintain an audit log of all the activities of each candidate who takes the test?

Yes, HackerEarth maintains an audit log of all the admins in a company. You can ask us for these audit logs by sending an email to [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com).

Another way to request the logs is through your Customer Success Manager or Account Manager if you have one assigned to you.

# How do I use HackerEarth’s API?

You can use the following API:

metadata.description: Here are the various guidelines that need to be followed for ID verification:

openGraph.content: Here are the various guidelines that need to be followed for ID verification:
What are the various guidelines for Photo ID and capturing an image for ID verification in HackerEarth?

headers.set-cookie:
__cf_bm=UWpcmiBpAxGXAORtiMmCVporX8IaXm1RIo_E2DomluU-1719138142-1.0.1.1-hY9tY4Kl5K6acFLbVllfEEMrkK9fGXCXYViFTxPK7sbkl0EO7.jDF5oahsyhE8n2BL3D1P6f0PIuEFmG5qPAzA; path=/; expires=Sun, 23-Jun-24 10:52:22 GMT; domain=.help.hackerearth.com; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None
__cfruid=44234a29c6a604e9c1a7e0cf0a83b4eaf38ee788-1719138142; path=/; domain=.help.hackerearth.com; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None

text:
What are the various guidelines for Photo ID and capturing an image for ID verification in HackerEarth?
Here are the various guidelines that need to be followed for ID verification: 
Aadhaar card
Your face and Aadhaar ID must be clearly visible in the image.
Please upload your updated Aadhaar card. If you have an old Aadhaar card, only the part containing your name, Aadhaar number, and face needs to be present in the uploaded ID.
PAN card
Your face and PAN ID must be clearly visible in the uploaded image.
Please upload your updated PAN card.
Captured image
Your face should be clearly visible in the captured image. Please make sure that your face is well-lit.
Make sure that no other people are visible in the captured image.
markdown:
# What are the various guidelines for Photo ID and capturing an image for ID verification in HackerEarth?

Here are the various guidelines that need to be followed for ID verification: 

### Aadhaar card

1.  Your face and Aadhaar ID must be clearly visible in the image.
2.  Please upload your updated Aadhaar card. If you have an old Aadhaar card, only the part containing your name, Aadhaar number, and face needs to be present in the uploaded ID.  
    ![ADAHAR](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/ADAHAR.jpg?width=458&height=305&name=ADAHAR.jpg)

### PAN card

1.  Your face and PAN ID must be clearly visible in the uploaded image.
2.  Please upload your updated PAN card.  
    ![PAN](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/PAN.jpg?width=491&height=327&name=PAN.jpg)

### Captured image

1.  Your face should be clearly visible in the captured image. Please make sure that your face is well-lit.
2.  Make sure that no other people are visible in the captured image. ![Rectangle 1011](https://help.hackerearth.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Rectangle%201011.png?width=467&height=283&name=Rectangle%201011.png)

text:
Is HackerEarth responsible for candidate data?
HackerEarth is only a processor or test enabler. The test itself is owned by the controller or the company that administered the test. 
The responsibility of updating and deleting all candidate data when requested by a candidate lies with the company. HackerEarth, however, will facilitate this process.
markdown:
# Is HackerEarth responsible for candidate data?

HackerEarth is only a processor or test enabler. The test itself is owned by the controller or the company that administered the test.

The responsibility of updating and deleting all candidate data when requested by a candidate lies with the company. HackerEarth, however, will [facilitate](https://support.hackerearth.com/hc/en-us/articles/360004967513-How-do-I-request-for-candidate-data-to-be-updated-or-deleted-) this process.

__cfruid=801c9472b272883d7780aa8c17475650e4c98e43-1719138144; path=/; domain=.help.hackerearth.com; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None

text:
With ChatGPT being able to solve MCQs, programming, etc. in a few minutes, does HackerEarth have a different set of problems that can be used?
Yes, HackerEarth has a wide variety of questions that you can use to flag the usage of ChatGPT in hiring assessments. We have a rich library of full-stack question types. As previously discussed, it will be difficult for a candidate to search for different modules and compile them to complete the question. It is a time taking and complex process and hence candidates will prefer to do these questions on their own.
Moreover, ChatGPT cannot understand logical real-life scenarios. The accuracy of such answers is poor. Use a mix of logical reasoning MCQs, DevOps, and Selenium questions to check the versatility of a candidate.
markdown:
# With ChatGPT being able to solve MCQs, programming, etc. in a few minutes, does HackerEarth have a different set of problems that can be used?

Yes, HackerEarth has a wide variety of questions that you can use to flag the usage of ChatGPT in hiring assessments. We have a rich library of full-stack question types. As previously discussed, it will be difficult for a candidate to search for different modules and compile them to complete the question. It is a time taking and complex process and hence candidates will prefer to do these questions on their own.

Moreover, ChatGPT cannot understand logical real-life scenarios. The accuracy of such answers is poor. Use a mix of logical reasoning MCQs, DevOps, and Selenium questions to check the versatility of a candidate.

markdown:
# I see an ‘Incorrect password’ error message when I try to log in.

If you see the 'Incorrect password' error message and you are sure that you have entered the right password, do the following:

*   Ensure that your **caps lock** key is turned off and try again.
*   Try logging in from another browser

If you're still unable to log into your account, reset your password.

# How do I set a favorite language for my submissions?

To set a favorite language for your submissions, follow these steps:

1.  Go to any of the practice problems. For example, [https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/basic-programming/input-output/basics-of-input-output/practice-problems/algorithm/modify-the-string](https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/basic-programming/input-output/basics-of-input-output/practice-problems/algorithm/modify-the-string)
2.  In the **Code Editor**, select your preferred language from the drop-down. For example, C++ (g++5.4.0).
3.  Click ![](https://help.hackerearth.com/hubfs/Knowledge%20Base%20Import/mceclip0-Jan-30-2023-11-44-45-1511-AM.png)  
4.  Click **Set C++ (g++5.4.0) as your favorite**.

You have successfully set your default language.

text:
Where does HackerEarth see pre-interview tests and interviewing to be moving to in a world where ChatGPT exists?
ChatGPT’s usage is increasing day by day and candidates are getting smarter at cheating on technical assessments. You have to be proactive to combat the usage of ChatGPT. To reduce the impact on the world of interviewing and pre-interview tests.
Hopefully, in the near future, advanced proctoring settings and new question types that will not be easily answerable using ChatGPT can help improve pre-interview tests. Plagiarism detection is also one of the solutions. Currently, any code generated by ChatGPT is difficult to detect.
markdown:
# Where does HackerEarth see pre-interview tests and interviewing to be moving to in a world where ChatGPT exists?

ChatGPT’s usage is increasing day by day and candidates are getting smarter at cheating on technical assessments. You have to be proactive to combat the usage of ChatGPT. To reduce the impact on the world of interviewing and pre-interview tests.

Hopefully, in the near future, advanced proctoring settings and new question types that will not be easily answerable using ChatGPT can help improve pre-interview tests. Plagiarism detection is also one of the solutions. Currently, any code generated by ChatGPT is difficult to detect.

text:
What is HackerEarth's plagiarism policy?
The Oxford dictionary defines plagiarism as ‘The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.’
Besides being illegal, it is extremely unfair to other candidates who participate by putting in immense amounts of time and effort.
Because we value the hard work that is put in by our community, we have decided to take a stand against plagiarism and do everything we can to prevent it.
Types of plagiarism
Outright plagiarism
Outright copying is when a candidate copies the code that is exactly the same as somebody else’s
Partial plagiarism
Partial plagiarism is changing some parts of the code but leaving most of it the same as the other candidate’s or when a candidate adapts parts of somebody else’s code.
Consequences
Academic reputation
Plagiarism allegations can cause a student to be suspended or expelled. Their academic record can reflect the ethics offense, possibly causing the student to be barred from entering another college. Schools, colleges, and universities take plagiarism very seriously.
Professional reputation
A professional business person may find that the damage from plagiarism follows them during their entire career. Not only will they likely be fired or asked to step down from their present position, but they will find it difficult to obtain another respectable job.
Legal repercussions
The legal repercussions of plagiarism can be quite serious. Copyright laws are absolute. One cannot use another person’s material without citing references. Some types of plagiarism may also be deemed a criminal offense.
Penalty
First-time offenders
Suspension from HackerEarth for 3 months
Second-time offenders
Suspension from HackerEarth for 6 months
Third-time offenders
Permanent suspension from HackerEarth
Important: Exceptions will not be made for any candidates who indulge in plagiarism. All the respective stakeholders (companies and colleges) will be made aware of the plagiarism.
Let's promise to stay plagiarism-free!
markdown:
# What is HackerEarth's plagiarism policy?

The Oxford dictionary defines plagiarism as ‘The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.’

Besides being illegal, it is extremely unfair to other candidates who participate by putting in immense amounts of time and effort.

Because we value the hard work that is put in by our community, we have decided to take a stand against plagiarism and do everything we can to prevent it.

## **Types of plagiarism**

### **Outright plagiarism**

Outright copying is when a candidate copies the code that is exactly the same as somebody else’s

### **Partial plagiarism**

Partial plagiarism is changing some parts of the code but leaving most of it the same as the other candidate’s or when a candidate adapts parts of somebody else’s code.

## **Consequences**

### **Academic reputation**

Plagiarism allegations can cause a student to be suspended or expelled. Their academic record can reflect the ethics offense, possibly causing the student to be barred from entering another college. Schools, colleges, and universities take plagiarism very seriously.

### **Professional reputation**

A professional business person may find that the damage from plagiarism follows them during their entire career. Not only will they likely be fired or asked to step down from their present position, but they will find it difficult to obtain another respectable job.

### **Legal repercussions**

The legal repercussions of plagiarism can be quite serious. Copyright laws are absolute. One cannot use another person’s material without citing references. Some types of plagiarism may also be deemed a criminal offense.

## **Penalty**

### **First-time offenders**

Suspension from HackerEarth for 3 months

### **Second-time offenders**

Suspension from HackerEarth for 6 months

### **Third-time offenders**

Permanent suspension from HackerEarth

_Important_: Exceptions will not be made for any candidates who indulge in plagiarism. All the respective stakeholders (companies and colleges) will be made aware of the plagiarism.

_**Let's promise to stay plagiarism-free!**_

How does the time duration work for hiring challenges?
You can participate in a hiring challenge at any time between its start and end times. Once you begin the challenge, you will not be able to pause it. For example, if the duration of a hiring challenge is two hours, once you click Start Test, you must finish the test within the next two hours.
markdown:
# How does the time duration work for hiring challenges?

You can participate in a hiring challenge at any time between its start and end times. Once you begin the challenge, you will not be able to pause it. For example, if the duration of a hiring challenge is two hours, once you click **Start Test**, you must finish the test within the next two hours.

text:
How do I request for candidate data to be updated or deleted?
Send us an email at support@hackerearth.com with the list of candidates whose data needs to be updated or deleted. If you have a Customer Success Manager or Account Manager, you can also route your request through them. 
HackerEarth will anonymize the data within 30 days of receiving your request and the list of candidates whose data needs to be updated or deleted.
You will receive a confirmation after we have updated or deleted the data.
markdown:
# How do I request for candidate data to be updated or deleted?

Send us an email at [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com) with the list of candidates whose data needs to be updated or deleted. If you have a Customer Success Manager or Account Manager, you can also route your request through them. 

HackerEarth will anonymize the data within 30 days of receiving your request and the list of candidates whose data needs to be updated or deleted.

You will receive a confirmation after we have updated or deleted the data.

markdown:
# My code is correct. Why am I seeing a runtime error?

When you click Compile and Run, your code is checked against the sample input and sample output by running it against multiple test files that aren’t visible to you. Runtime errors may occur because of the following reasons:

*   Your code does not satisfy all the constraints
*   Your code is not correct for all the possible scenarios

Read the problem statement again, understand it, and write code to solve all the possible scenarios.

# Can you send me my password without resetting it?

How do I stop search engines (e.g. Google) from linking my HackerEarth user profile?

text:
How do I stop search engines (e.g. Google) from linking my HackerEarth user profile?
You can prevent this from happening by turning off your public profile from Account Settings.
Once your public profile is turned off, only other logged-in users will be able to see your profile. Users who haven’t logged in and search engines will get a 404 (server not found) error.
markdown:
# How do I stop search engines (e.g. Google) from linking my HackerEarth user profile?

You can prevent this from happening by turning off your public profile from Account Settings.

Once your public profile is turned off, only other logged-in users will be able to see your profile. Users who haven’t logged in and search engines will get a 404 (server not found) error.

metadata.title: What happens if someone cheats in a challenge or test?
metadata.description: The Oxford dictionary defines plagiarism as, ‘The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.’ Besides being illegal, plagiarism is unfair to other candidates wh

openGraph.content: The Oxford dictionary defines plagiarism as, ‘The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.’ Besides being illegal, plagiarism is unfair to other candidates wh
What happens if someone cheats in a challenge or test?

text:
What happens if someone cheats in a challenge or test?
The Oxford dictionary defines plagiarism as, ‘The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.’ 
Besides being illegal, plagiarism is unfair to other candidates who participate in our challenges and hackathons by putting in immense amounts of time and effort. Because we value the hard work that is put in by our community, we have decided to take a stand against plagiarism and do everything we can to prevent it.
Types of plagiarism
Outright plagiarism: Outright copying is when a candidate copies code that is exactly the same as somebody else’s. 
Partial plagiarism: Partial plagiarism is changing some parts of the code but leaving most of it the same as the other candidate’s or when a candidate adapts parts of somebody else’s code. 
Consequences
Academic reputation: Plagiarism allegations can cause a student to be suspended or expelled. Their academic record can reflect the ethics offence, possibly causing the student to be barred from entering another college. Schools, colleges, and universities take plagiarism very seriously. 
Professional reputation: A professional business person may find that the damage from plagiarism follows them during their entire career. Not only will they likely be fired or asked to step down from their present position, but they will find it difficult to obtain another respectable job. 
Legal repercussions: The legal repercussions of plagiarism can be quite serious. Copyright laws are absolute. One cannot use another person’s material without citing references. Some types of plagiarism may also be deemed a criminal offence. 
Penalty
First-time offenders: Suspension from HackerEarth for 3 months
Second-time offenders: Suspension from HackerEarth for 6 months
Third-time offenders: Permanent suspension from HackerEarth
Important
Exceptions will not be made for any candidates who indulge in plagiarism
All the respective stakeholders (companies and colleges) will be made aware of the plagiarism
markdown:
# What happens if someone cheats in a challenge or test?

The Oxford dictionary defines plagiarism as, ‘The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.’

Besides being illegal, plagiarism is unfair to other candidates who participate in our challenges and hackathons by putting in immense amounts of time and effort. Because we value the hard work that is put in by our community, we have decided to take a stand against plagiarism and do everything we can to prevent it.

_Types of plagiarism_

*   **Outright plagiarism:** Outright copying is when a candidate copies code that is exactly the same as somebody else’s.
*   **Partial plagiarism:** Partial plagiarism is changing some parts of the code but leaving most of it the same as the other candidate’s or when a candidate adapts parts of somebody else’s code.

_Consequences_

*   **Academic reputation:** Plagiarism allegations can cause a student to be suspended or expelled. Their academic record can reflect the ethics offence, possibly causing the student to be barred from entering another college. Schools, colleges, and universities take plagiarism very seriously.
*   **Professional reputation:** A professional business person may find that the damage from plagiarism follows them during their entire career. Not only will they likely be fired or asked to step down from their present position, but they will find it difficult to obtain another respectable job.
*   **Legal repercussions:** The legal repercussions of plagiarism can be quite serious. Copyright laws are absolute. One cannot use another person’s material without citing references. Some types of plagiarism may also be deemed a criminal offence.

_Penalty_

*   First-time offenders: Suspension from HackerEarth for 3 months
*   Second-time offenders: Suspension from HackerEarth for 6 months
*   Third-time offenders: Permanent suspension from HackerEarth

_Important_

*   Exceptions will not be made for any candidates who indulge in plagiarism
*   All the respective stakeholders (companies and colleges) will be made aware of the plagiarism

text:
How do I deactivate my account?
To deactivate your account, follow these steps:
Click on the top right corner of the screen. 
Click Settings. 
In the General section, scroll to the end of the page and then click Deactivate Account. 
Specify your reason for deactivation and click Submit. 
Your account will be deactivated immediately and hidden from other users.
markdown:
# How do I deactivate my account?

To deactivate your account, follow these steps:

1.  Click on the top right corner of the screen.
2.  Click **Settings**.
3.  In the **General** section, scroll to the end of the page and then click **Deactivate Account**.
4.  Specify your reason for deactivation and click **Submit**.

Your account will be deactivated immediately and hidden from other users.

markdown:
# I have solved many problems but I am not able to view my percentile graph. Where can I see it?

While you may have done well in certain languages, it is possible that your percentile is low for other languages. Graphs are not displayed for low percentiles.

Once your percentile increases, your graph will be visible automatically. To increase your percentile, you can do the following:

*   Solve problems on HackerEarth
*   Increase your activity on your open source projects in Github

text:
I have solved more than 100 problems on the HackerEarth platform. Could you send me a t-shirt?
That's awesome! However, we have stopped this campaign indefinitely.
The purpose of introducing this was to encourage people to genuinely solve problems but we had a lot of cases of plagiarism, which is totally against the spirit of HackerEarth.
markdown:
# I have solved more than 100 problems on the HackerEarth platform. Could you send me a t-shirt?

That's awesome! However, we have stopped this campaign indefinitely.

The purpose of introducing this was to encourage people to genuinely solve problems but we had a lot of cases of plagiarism, which is totally against the spirit of HackerEarth.

markdown:
# How do I reset my password?

To reset your password, follow these steps:

1.  Click [https://www.hackerearth.com/password/reset/](https://www.hackerearth.com/password/reset/).
2.  Enter your registered email ID.
3.  Click the password-reset link that has been sent to your email ID.
4.  Enter your new password and confirm it.
5.  Click **Change Password**.

You have successfully reset your password.

text:
Problem explanation in a live Hiring Challenge?
Since it's a hiring challenge, we cannot assist you with the explanation of the problem. However, once the challenge is over and the problems will be moved to practice area 7 days after the completion of the challenge, you can see submissions by other people and read the editorial.
markdown:
# Problem explanation in a live Hiring Challenge?

Since it's a hiring challenge, we cannot assist you with the explanation of the problem. However, once the challenge is over and the problems will be moved to practice area 7 days after the completion of the challenge, you can see submissions by other people and read the editorial.

text:
How can I get a HackerEarth t-shirt?
There are multiple ways of winning a cool HackerEarth t-shirt. These include the following:
Participate in any of our monthly contests like Easy contest, Clash contest, and Long contest 
Become a HackerEarth campus ambassador 
Find a bug on HackerEarth. Write to us at support@hackerearth.com with the following information: 
Details about the bug
Steps to reproduce the bug
We will analyze the bug, and if it is a valid bug, we will send you a t-shirt.
markdown:
# How can I get a HackerEarth t-shirt?

There are multiple ways of winning a cool HackerEarth t-shirt. These include the following:

1.  Participate in any of our [_monthly contests_](https://www.hackerearth.com/challenges/competitive/) like Easy contest, Clash contest, and Long contest
2.  Become a HackerEarth _campus ambassador_
3.  Find a bug on HackerEarth. Write to us at [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com) with the following information:

1.  Details about the bug
2.  Steps to reproduce the bug

We will analyze the bug, and if it is a _valid bug_, we will send you a t-shirt.

markdown:
# I need help with a problem statement that is a part of a live challenge. What should I do?

We cannot assist you with problems that are a part of a live challenge because you are supposed to solve the problems on your own. If your problem is a part of the Practice section, then read the editorial section or solutions submitted by other candidates for that specific problem.

All the problem statements of a hiring challenge are moved to the Practice section one week after the challenge ends. You will be able to access the problem statements, other user's solutions, and test cases.

# I want to write editorials for problem statements on the HackerEarth platform. How do I do this?

To submit an editorial, follow these steps:

1.  Go to the problem page mentioned in the email.
2.  Click the editorial section.
3.  Click "edit editorial" button.  
    

You can submit your editorial in the editor displayed.

text:
I have already uploaded my resume. How do I modify it?
You can modify it by uploading the updated resume. This change will be made globally.
To upload your resume, follow these steps:
Click on the top right corner of the screen. 
Click Settings. 
In Jobs Settings, click Choose file. 
Navigate to the folder in which you have saved your resume.
Click the file to select it.
Click Open to upload your resume. 
You have successfully updated your resume.
markdown:
# I have already uploaded my resume. How do I modify it?

You can modify it by uploading the updated resume. This change will be made globally.

To upload your resume, follow these steps:

1.  Click on the top right corner of the screen.
2.  Click **Settings**.
3.  In **Jobs Settings**, click **Choose file.**
4.  Navigate to the folder in which you have saved your resume.
5.  Click the file to select it.
6.  Click **Open** to upload your resume.

You have successfully updated your resume.

markdown:
# I’m not receiving the verification email.

Check the spam or junk mail folder in the email account that is linked to your HackerEarth account.

Sometimes there is a backlog of emails and email delivery can take some time. You should receive the email shortly. If the issue still persists send an email to [support@hackerearth.com](mailto:support@hackerearth.com).

text:
The hiring challenge requires candidates with experience. I am a fresher. Can I participate?
Yes, you can. However, we recommend that you participate in such challenges from a preparatory point of view. We share the entire list of candidates with the company. While few freshers have been hired in the past even though they did not fit the company’s requirements but did exceptionally well, there is no guarantee that all companies will do this.
markdown:
# The hiring challenge requires candidates with experience. I am a fresher. Can I participate?

Yes, you can. However, we recommend that you participate in such challenges from a preparatory point of view. We share the entire list of candidates with the company. While few freshers have been hired in the past even though they did not fit the company’s requirements but did exceptionally well, there is no guarantee that all companies will do this.

text:
How do I improve my programming skills?
There are a lot of resources in HackerEarth’s Practice section, which you can use to improve your programming skills:
Tutorials: Detailed explanations with examples that you can use to learn and strengthen your basics. For more information, see this. 
Topics: Multiple topics in each tutorial with relevant problems to choose from and solve. For more information, see this. 
Solve problems regularly to see an improvement in your programming skills. We also conduct competitive challenges that you can participate in and test your skills while competing with thousands of developers from our global HackerEarth community.
markdown:
# How do I improve my programming skills?

There are a lot of resources in HackerEarth’s [Practice section](https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/), which you can use to improve your programming skills:

1.  **Tutorials:** Detailed explanations with examples that you can use to learn and strengthen your basics. For more information, see [this](https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/basic-programming/input-output/basics-of-input-output/tutorial/).
2.  **Topics**: Multiple topics in each tutorial with relevant problems to choose from and solve. For more information, see [this](https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/algorithms/searching/linear-search/tutorial/).

Solve problems regularly to see an improvement in your programming skills. We also conduct competitive challenges that you can participate in and test your skills while competing with thousands of developers from our global HackerEarth community.
